translated: Having thought, What should be done? he became the boar with wondrous limbs.🔽Having the luster equal to a great dense cloud, wearing a long garland and ornaments,

analyzed: sa śaṅkha cakra asi dharaḥ kirīṭī sa veda vedāṅga mayaḥ mahātmā
translated: Wearing a crown, holding a conch, discus, and sword, the great soul consisting of the Vedas and Vedangas,

analyzed: trailokya nirmāṇa karaḥ purāṇaḥ deva trayī rūpa dharaḥ ca kārye
translated: The ancient one who created the three worlds, and who assumed the form of the three deities for the purpose of the work.

original: sa eva rudraḥ sa jagajjahāra sṛṣṭyarthamīśaḥ prapitāmaho 'bhūt /
analyzed: saḥ eva rudraḥ sa jagat jahāra sṛṣṭi artham īśaḥ prapitāmahaḥ bhūt
translated: He is indeed Rudra, he withdrew the world. For the sake of creation, the Lord became the great-grandfather.

original: saṃrakṣaṇārthaṃ jagataḥ sa eva hariḥ sucakrāsigadābjapāṇiḥ // / //
analyzed: saṃrakṣaṇa artham jagataḥ saḥ eva hariḥ su cakra asi gadā abja pāṇiḥ
translated: For the sake of protecting the world, he is indeed Hari, holding a discus, sword, club, and lotus in his hands.

original: teṣāṃ vibhāgo na hi kartumarho mahātmanām ekaśarīrabhājām /
analyzed: teṣām vibhāgaḥ na hi kartum arhaḥ mahātmanām eka śarīra bhājām
translated: Their division is not worthy to be made of those great souls who share the same body.

analyzed: mīmāṃsā hetu artha viśeṣa tarkaiḥ yaḥ teṣu kuryāt pravibhedam ajñaḥ
translated: The ignorant one who makes a distinction among them by reasoning on the meaning of the reasons for the Mimamsa,

original: sa yāti ghoraṃ narakaṃ krameṇa vibhāgakṛddveṣamatirdurātmā /
analyzed: sa yāti ghoram narakam krameṇa vibhāga kṛt dveṣa matiḥ durātmā
translated: That evil-minded one who makes a division out of hatred goes to hell in due order.

original: yā yasya bhaktiḥ sa tayaiva nūnaṃ dehaṃ tyajan svaṃ hyamṛtatvameti // / //
analyzed: yā yasya bhaktiḥ sa tayā eva nūnam deham tyajan svam hi amṛta tvam eti
translated: Whoever has devotion to whom, by that alone, forsaking his body, he attains immortality.

original: saṃmohayan mūrtibhir atra lokaṃ sraṣṭā ca goptā kṣayakṛtsa devaḥ /
analyzed: saṃmohayan mūrtibhiḥ atra lokam sraṣṭā ca goptā kṣaya kṛt sa devaḥ
translated: Deluding the world with his forms, he is the creator, protector and destroyer of all.

original: tasmān na mohātmakamāviśeta dveṣaṃ na kuryāt pravibhinnamūrtiḥ // / //
analyzed: tasmāt na moha ātmakam āviśeta dveṣam na kuryāt pravibhinna mūrtiḥ
translated: Therefore, one should not enter into delusion, nor should one hate him, whose form is divided.

original: vārāhamīśānavaro 'pyato 'sau rūpaṃ samāsthāya jagadvidhātā /🔽naṣṭe triloke 'rṇavatoyamagne vimārgitoyaughamaye 'ntarātmā // / //🔽bhittvārṇavaṃ toyamathāntarasthaṃ viveśa pātālatalaṃ kṣaṇena /
analyzed: vārāham īśāna varaḥ sau rūpam samāsthāya jagat vidhātā  naṣṭe triloke rṇava toya magne vimārgita uya ogha maye ntarātmā  bhittvā arṇavam toyam atha antara stham viveśa pātāla talam kṣaṇena
translated: Therefore, the best lord, the creator of the world, assuming the form of a boar,🔽when the three worlds were destroyed and submerged in the waters of the ocean, searching for the submerged waters within,🔽penetrating the ocean and the waters within, entered the nether regions in an instant.

analyzed: jale nimagnām dharaṇīm samastām samaspṛśat paṅkaja patra netrām
translated: Touching the entire earth submerged in the water, with eyes like lotus petals,

analyzed: viśīrṇa śaila upala śṛṅga kūṭām vasuṃdharām tām pralaye pralīnām
translated: the earth, with its mountains, rocks and peaks shattered, dissolved at the time of dissolution,

analyzed: daṃṣṭrā ekayā viṣṇuḥ atulya sāhasaḥ samuddadhāra svayam eva devaḥ
translated: with his single tusk, Vishnu, of incomparable valor, the god himself, lifted it up.

analyzed: sā tasya daṃṣṭra agra vilambita aṅgī kailāsa śṛṅga agra gatā iva jyotsnā
translated: That earth, hanging from the tip of his tusk, like moonlight on the peak of Mount Kailash,

original: vibhrājate sāpyasamānamūrtiḥ śaśāṅkaśṛṅge ca taḍidvilagnā // / //🔽tāmujjahārārṇavatoyamagnāṃ karī nimagnāmiva hastinīṃ haṭhāt /
analyzed: vibhrājate sā api asamāna mūrtiḥ śaśāṅka śṛṅge ca taḍit vilagnā  tām ujjahāra arṇava toya magnām karī nimagnām iva hastinīm haṭhāt
translated: She also shines with a form unequalled, like lightning clinging to the peak of the moon.🔽He forcibly lifted her out of the submerged ocean water, like an elephant lifting a submerged female elephant.

original: nāvaṃ viśīrṇāmiva toyamadhyād udīrṇasattvo 'nupamaprabhāvaḥ // / //🔽sa tāṃ samuttārya mahājalaughāt samudramāryo vyabhajatsamastam /
analyzed: nāvam viśīrṇām iva toya madhyāt udīrṇa sattvaḥ nu pama prabhāvaḥ  sa tām samuttārya mahā jala oghāt samudram āryaḥ vyabhajat samastam
translated: With unsurpassed power, he lifted her out of the water, like a broken boat in the middle of the water.🔽Having lifted her out of the great flood of water, the noble one divided the entire ocean.

analyzed: mahā arṇaveṣu eva mahā arṇava ambhaḥ nikṣepayāmāsa punar nadīṣu
translated: He again deposited the water of the great oceans into the great oceans and rivers.

original: śīrṇāṃśca śailānsa cakāra bhūyo dvīpānsamastāṃśca tathārṇavāṃśca /
analyzed: śīrṇān ca śailān sa cakāra bhūyas dvīpān samastān ca tathā arṇavān ca
translated: He again made the shattered mountains and all the continents and oceans.

analyzed: śaila upalaiḥ ye vicitāḥ samantāt śiloccayān tān sa cakāra kalpe
translated: In the kalpa, he made those mountain peaks that were searched all around with mountain rocks.

analyzed: aneka rūpam pravibhajya deham cakāra deva indra gaṇān samastān
translated: Having divided his body into many forms, he made all the groups of Indra of the gods.

original: mukhācca vahnirmanasaśca candraścakṣośca sūryaḥ sahasā babhūva // / //
analyzed: mukhāt ca vahniḥ manasaḥ ca candraḥ cakṣoḥ ca sūryaḥ sahasā babhūva
translated: And suddenly from his mouth, fire, from his mind, the moon, and from his eyes, the sun arose.

analyzed: jajñe tha tasya īśvara yoga mūrteḥ pradhyāyamānasya sura indra saṅghaḥ
translated: Then from the meditating mass of the lord's yogic form, a group of Indra of the gods was born.

original: vedāśca yajñāśca tathaiva varṇās tathā hi sarvauṣadhayo rasāśca // / //🔽jagatsamastaṃ manasā babhūva yatsthāvaraṃ kiṃcidihāṇḍajaṃ vā /
analyzed: vedāḥ ca yajñāḥ ca tathā eva varṇāḥ tathā hi sarva oṣadhayaḥ rasāḥ ca  jagat samastam manasā babhūva yat sthāvaram kiṃcid iha aṇḍa jam vā
translated: The Vedas, sacrifices, the social classes, and all herbs and juices,🔽The entire universe, whatever is born from a womb, or from an egg,

original: jarāyujaṃ svedajam udbhijjaṃ vā yat kiṃcid ā kīṭapipīlakādyam // / //
analyzed: jarāyu jam sveda jam udbhid jam vā yat kiṃcid ā kīṭa pipīlaka ādyam
translated: Or from moisture, or that grows from sprouts, or even insects, ants, and so on,

original: tato vijajñe manasā kṣaṇena anekarūpāḥ sahasā maheśā /
analyzed: tatas vijajñe manasā kṣaṇena aneka rūpāḥ sahasā mahā īśā
translated: In an instant, he created with his mind many such forms, of great power.

original: cakāra yanmūrtibhir avyayātmā aṣṭābhir āviśya punaḥ sa tatra // / //🔽līlāṃ cakārātha samṛddhatejā ato 'tra me paśyata eva viprāḥ /
analyzed: cakāra yat mūrtibhiḥ avyaya ātmā aṣṭābhiḥ āviśya punar sa tatra  līlām cakāra atha samṛddha tejāḥ me paśyataḥ eva viprāḥ
translated: The one with an imperishable soul, having entered there with eight forms,🔽Then he performed a play, with his abundant splendor. Therefore, O Brahmins, behold it here itself.

original: teṣāṃ mayā darśanameva sarvaṃ yāvanmuhūrtātsamakāri bhūpa // / //
analyzed: teṣām mayā darśanam eva sarvam yāvat muhūrtāt sama kāri bhūpa
translated: I saw the entire vision of them, O king, in a moment.

original: kṛtvā tvaśeṣaṃ kila līlayaiva sa devadevo jagatāṃ vidhātā /
analyzed: kṛtvā tu aśeṣam kila līlayā eva sa devadevaḥ jagatām vidhātā
translated: Having done everything playfully, indeed, that god of gods, the creator of the worlds,

analyzed: sarvatra dṛś sarvage eva devaḥ jagāma ca adarśanam ādi kartā
translated: The all-seeing, all-pervading god, the primordial creator, disappeared.

analyzed: yat tat muhūrtāt iha nāma rūpam tāvat prapaśyāmi jagat tathā eva
translated: That very form and name which I saw here for a moment, I see the world just like that.

analyzed: dvīpaiḥ samudraiḥ abhisaṃvṛtam hi nakṣatra tārā ādi vimāna kīrṇam
translated: Surrounded by islands and oceans, filled with stars, constellations, and celestial vehicles.

analyzed: viyat payoda graha cakra citram nānāvidhaiḥ prāṇi gaṇaiḥ vṛtam ca
translated: The sky, the clouds, the planets and the stars are all different, and the various kinds of living beings are also different.

original: tāṃ vai na paśyāmi mahānubhāvāṃ gorūpiṇīṃ sarvasureśvarīṃ ca // / //
analyzed: tām vai na paśyāmi mahā anubhāvām go rūpiṇīm sarva sura īśvarīm ca
translated: But I do not see that greatly powerful one, the goddess of all gods in the form of a cow.

original: kva sāṃprataṃ seti vicintya rājanvibhrāntacittastvabhavaṃ tadaiva /
analyzed: kva sāṃpratam sā iti vicintya rājan vibhrānta cittaḥ tu abhavam tadā eva
translated: O king, thinking where she is now, my mind became bewildered at that very moment.

analyzed: diśaḥ vibhāgān avalokayān ṛte punar tām katham īśvara aṅgīm
translated: Looking at the different directions, I could not see that goddess again.

original: paśyāmi tāmatra punaśca śubhrāṃ mahābhranīlāṃ śuciśubhratoyām /
analyzed: paśyāmi tām atra punar ca śubhrām mahā abhra nīlām śuci śubhra toyām
translated: But I saw that same white river, with water as pure and bright as the blue sky,

analyzed: vṛkṣaiḥ anekaiḥ upaśobhita aṅgīm gajaiḥ turaṅgaiḥ vihagaiḥ vṛtām ca
translated: adorned with many trees, and filled with elephants, horses and birds.

analyzed: yathā purā tīram upetya devyāḥ samāsthitaḥ ca api amarakaṇṭake tu
translated: O god, just as before, having reached the bank of the goddess and staying in Amarakantaka,

analyzed: tathā eva paśyāmi sukha upaviṣṭaḥ ātmānam avyagram avāpta saukhyam
translated: I saw myself happily seated, free from anxiety and having attained bliss.

original: tathaiva puṇyā malatoyavāhāṃ dṛṣṭvā punaḥ kalpaparikṣaye 'pi /
analyzed: tathā eva puṇyāḥ mala toyavāhām dṛṣṭvā punar kalpa parikṣaye
translated: Seeing that same holy river with pure water, even at the end of the world-destroying fire,

original: ambām ivāryām anukampamānām akṣīṇatoyāṃ virujāṃ viśokaḥ // / //
analyzed: ambām iva āryām anukampamānām akṣīṇa toyām virujām viśokaḥ
translated: I was free from sorrow and disease, like a noble mother full of compassion, with inexhaustible water.

original: evaṃ mahatpuṇyatamaṃ ca kalpaṃ paṭhanti śṛṇvanti ca ye dvijendrāḥ /
analyzed: evam mahat puṇyatamam ca kalpam paṭhanti śṛṇvanti ca ye dvijendrāḥ
translated: Thus, those best of Brahmins who recite and listen to this extremely meritorious Kalpa,

original: mahāvarāhasya maheśvarasya dine dine te vimalā bhavanti // / //
analyzed: mahāvarāhasya maheśvarasya dine dine te vimalāḥ bhavanti
translated: Day by day, they become pure, of the great boar, the great Lord.

analyzed: aśubha śata sahasram te vidhūya prapannāḥ tridivam amara juṣṭam siddha gandharva yuktam
translated: Having shaken off hundreds of thousands of inauspicious deeds, they attain heaven frequented by the immortals, inhabited by Siddhas and Gandharvas.

original: vimalaśaśinibhābhiḥ sarva evāpsarobhiḥ saha vividhavilāsaiḥ svargasaukhyaṃ labhante // / //🔽iti śrīskānde mahāpurāṇa ekāśītisāhasryāṃ saṃhitāyāṃ pañcama āvantyakhaṇḍe revākhaṇḍe śrīnarmadāmāhātmye vārāhakalpavṛttāntavarṇanaṃ nāmaikonaviṃśo 🔽'dhyāyaḥ //
analyzed: vimala śaśi nibhābhiḥ sarve eva apsarobhiḥ saha vividha vilāsaiḥ svarga saukhyam labhante  iti śrī skānde mahāpurāṇe ekāśīti sāhasryām saṃhitāyām pañcame āvantya khaṇḍe revākhaṇḍe śrī narmadāmāhātmye vārāhakalpavṛttāntavarṇanam nāma ekonaviṃśaḥ  dhyāyaḥ
translated: All of them, along with the celestial nymphs who are as radiant as the pure moon, attain heavenly bliss with various kinds of amusements.

analyzed: rku adhyāya
translated: Thus ends the nineteenth chapter in the Skanda Purana, in the fifth Avantaya Khanda, in the Rewa Khanda, describing the events of the Varāha Kalpa in the greatness of Shri Narmada.🔽Chapter 20

analyzed: yudhiṣṭhiraḥ uvāca
translated: Yudhisthira said:

analyzed: śrutāḥ me vividhāḥ dharmāḥ saṃhārāḥ tvad prasādataḥ
translated: I have heard about various Dharmas and destructions through your grace.

original: kṛtā devena sarveṇa ye ca dṛṣṭāstvayānagha // / //
analyzed: kṛtāḥ devena sarveṇa ye ca dṛṣṭāḥ tvayā anagha
translated: O sinless one, all of them have been seen by you, who have been created by the Lord himself.

analyzed: sāmpratam śrotum icchāmi prabhāvam śārṅgadhanvanaḥ
translated: Now I wish to hear about the power of the wielder of the Sharnga bow.

analyzed: tvayā anubhūtam vipra indra tat me tvam vaktum arhasi
translated: O best of Brahmins, you have experienced it. It is proper for you to tell me that.

analyzed: śrī mārkaṇḍeyaḥ uvāca
translated: The illustrious Markandeya said:

analyzed: atas param pravakṣyāmi prajā saṃhāra lakṣaṇam
translated: After this, I will describe the signs of the destruction of beings,

original: yaccihnaṃ dṛśyate tatra yathā kalpo vidhīyate // / //
analyzed: yat cihnam dṛśyate tatra yathā kalpaḥ vidhīyate
translated: The signs that are seen there, and how the kalpa is performed.

analyzed: ulkā pātāḥ sa nirghātā bhūmikampaḥ tathā eva ca
translated: Meteors fall with loud noises, and there are earthquakes,

analyzed: patate pāṃśu varṣam ca nirghoṣaḥ ca eva dāruṇaḥ
translated: A rain of dust falls, and there is a terrible sound.

analyzed: yakṣa kinnara gandharvāḥ piśāca uraga rākṣasāḥ
translated: Yakshas, kinnaras, gandharvas, pishachas, serpents, and rakshasas,

original: sarve te pralayaṃ yānti yugānte samupasthite // / //
analyzed: sarve te pralayam yānti yuga ante samupasthite
translated: All of them perish when the end of the yuga arrives.

original: parvatāḥ sāgarā nadyaḥ sarāṃsi vividhāni ca /🔽vṛkṣāḥ śeṣaṃ samāyānti vallījātaṃ tṛṇāni ca // / //🔽evaṃ hi vyākulībhūte sarvauṣadhijalojjhite /
analyzed: parvatāḥ sāgarāḥ nadyaḥ sarāṃsi vividhāni ca  vṛkṣāḥ śeṣam samāyānti vallī jātam tṛṇāni ca  evam hi vyākulībhūte sarva oṣadhi jala ujjhite
translated: Mountains, oceans, rivers, and various lakes,🔽Trees, vines, and grasses all remain.🔽When everything is in chaos, devoid of herbs and water,

analyzed: kāṣṭha bhūte tu saṃjāte trailokye sa carācare
translated: And the three worlds, with their moving and unmoving beings, become like wood.

analyzed: yāvat paśyāmi madhyāhne snāna kāle upasthite
translated: When I see at midday, at the time of bathing,

original: trailokyaṃ jvalanākāraṃ durnirīkṣaṃ durāsadam // / //🔽dvau sūryau pūrvatastāta paścimottarayostathā /
analyzed: trailokyam jvalana ākāram durnirīkṣam durāsadam  dvau sūryau pūrvatas tāta paścima uttarayoḥ tathā
translated: The three worlds ablaze, difficult to look at and approach.🔽Two suns in the east, dear one, and in the west and north,

original: tathaiva dakṣiṇe dvau ca sūryau dṛṣṭau pratāpinau // / //
analyzed: tathā eva dakṣiṇe dvau ca sūryau dṛṣṭau pratāpinau
translated: And two scorching suns seen in the south.

original: dvau sūryau nāgalokasthau madhye dvau gaganasya ca /
analyzed: dvau sūryau nāga loka sthau madhye dvau gaganasya ca
translated: Two suns are in the world of serpents, two in the middle of the sky.

analyzed: iti ete dvādaśa ādityāḥ tapante sarvatas diśam
translated: Thus these twelve suns shine in all directions.

analyzed: pṛthivīm adahan sarvām sa śaila vana kānanām
translated: They burn the entire earth with its mountains, forests and groves.

original: nādagdhaṃ dṛśyate kiṃcidṛte revāṃ ca māṃ tathā // / //
analyzed: na adagdham dṛśyate kiṃcid ṛte revām ca mām tathā
translated: Nothing is seen to be burnt, except the Revā river and myself.

analyzed: pṛthivyām dahyamānāyām haviḥ gandhaḥ ca jāyate
translated: When the earth is burning, the smell of oblations arises.

original: tato me śuṣyate gātraṃ tṛṣāpyevaṃ durāsadā // / //
analyzed: tatas me śuṣyate gātram tṛṣā api evam durāsadā
translated: Then my body dries up, and thirst becomes unbearable.

original: na hi vindāmi pānīyaṃ śoṣitaṃ ca divākaraiḥ /
analyzed: na hi vindāmi pānīyam śoṣitam ca divākaraiḥ
translated: I do not find water, as it is dried up by the suns.

analyzed: yāvat kamaṇḍalum vīkṣe śuṣkam tatra api tat jalam
translated: When I look into the water pot, the water there is also dried up.

analyzed: tatas ham śoka saṃtaptaḥ viśeṣāt kṣudh tṛṣā arditaḥ
translated: Then I, tormented by grief, especially afflicted by hunger and thirst,

analyzed: utpapāta kṣiteḥ ūrdhvam paśyamānaḥ divam prati
translated: rose up from the earth, looking towards the sky.

analyzed: tāvat paśyāmi gagane gṛham śṛṅgāra bhūṣitam
translated: Then I saw a house adorned with love in the sky.

analyzed: tatas tad jñātu kāmaḥ ham prasthitaḥ rāja sattama  prākāreṇa vicitreṇa kapāṭa argala bhūṣitam
translated: O best of kings, desiring to know that, I set out.🔽It was adorned with a wonderful rampart, doors and bolts.

analyzed: vicitra śikhara upetam dvāra deśam upāgataḥ
translated: I reached the door region, which was endowed with a wonderful peak.

analyzed: ṣaṣ aśīti sahasrāṇi yojanānām samucchraye
translated: It was sixty-eight thousand yojanas in height.

original: tadardhaṃ tu pṛthaktvena kāñcanaṃ ratnabhūṣitam // / //🔽tatra madhye parāṃ śayyāṃ paśyāmi nṛpasattama /
analyzed: tad ardham tu pṛthaktvena kāñcanam ratna bhūṣitam  tatra madhye parām śayyām paśyāmi nṛpa sattama
translated: Half of that, separately, was made of gold and adorned with jewels.🔽In the middle of that, O best of kings, I saw a supreme bed.

analyzed: śayyā upari śayānam tu puruṣam divya mūrdhajam
translated: On the bed, I saw a man lying down, with a divine head of hair.

original: vikuñcitāgrakeśāntaṃ samastaṃ yojanāyatam /🔽mukuṭena vicitreṇa dīptikāntena śobhitam // / //🔽śyāmaṃ kamalapatrābhaṃ suprabhaṃ ca sunāsikam /
analyzed: vikuñcita agra keśa antam samastam yojana āyatam  mukuṭena vicitreṇa dīpti kāntena śobhitam  śyāmam kamala patra ābham su prabham ca su nāsikam
translated: With the tips of his hair curled, and his entire body extending for a yojana,🔽He was adorned with a colorful crown, shining with radiance.🔽He was dark, with a complexion like a lotus leaf, very radiant, and had a fine nose.

analyzed: siṃha āsyam āyata bhujam galla śmaśru vara aṅkitam  trivalī bhaṅga subhagam karṇa kuṇḍala bhūṣitam
translated: He had a lion's face, long arms, and was marked with an excellent beard on his chin.🔽He was beautiful with three folds of skin on his belly, and adorned with earrings.

original: viśālābhaṃ supīnāṅgaṃ pārśvasvāvartabhūṣitam // / //🔽śobhitaṃ kaṭibhāgena vibhaktaṃ jānujaṅghayoḥ /
analyzed: viśāla ābham su pīna aṅgam pārśva su āvarta bhūṣitam  śobhitam kaṭi bhāgena vibhaktam jānu jaṅghayoḥ
translated: He had a broad chest, well-developed limbs, and was adorned with curls on his sides.🔽He was beautiful with his waist, and his knees and shanks were well-proportioned.

analyzed: padma aṅkita talam devam ātāmra su nakha aṅgulim
translated: The god had feet marked with lotuses, and his fingers and toes were of a beautiful reddish color.

analyzed: megha nāda su gambhīram sarva avayava sundaram
translated: His voice was as deep as the rumbling of clouds, and he was beautiful in every limb.

analyzed: śayyā madhya gatam devam apaśyam puruṣottamam
translated: I saw the god, the best of men, lying down in the middle of the bed.

analyzed: śaṅkha cakra gadā pāṇim śayānam dakṣiṇena tu
translated: With a conch, discus, and mace in his hands, he was lying down on his right side.

analyzed: akṣa sūtra udyata karam sūrya ayuta sama prabham
translated: With a rosary held in his hand, and with a radiance equal to that of ten thousand suns.

original: taṃ dṛṣṭvā bhaktimāndevaṃ stotukāmo vyavasthitaḥ /🔽jayeśa jaya vāgīśa jaya divyāṅgabhūṣaṇa // / //
analyzed: tam dṛṣṭvā bhaktimān devam stotu kāmaḥ vyavasthitaḥ  jaya īśa jaya vāgīśa jaya divya aṅga bhūṣaṇa
translated: Having seen him, full of devotion, he stood ready to praise the Lord.🔽Victory to the Lord, victory to the Lord of Speech, victory to the one adorned with divine limbs.

analyzed: jaya devapate śrīman sākṣāt brahma sanātana
translated: Victory to the glorious Lord of gods, the eternal Brahman itself.

analyzed: tava lokāḥ śarīra sthāḥ tvam gatiḥ parameśvara
translated: Your worlds are established in the body, you are the ultimate refuge, O Supreme Lord.

original: tvadādhārā hi deveśa sarve lokā vyavasthitāḥ /
analyzed: tvad ādhārāḥ hi deveśa sarve lokāḥ vyavasthitāḥ
translated: O Lord of gods, all the worlds are established depending on you.

original: tvaṃ śreṣṭhaḥ sarvasattvānāṃ tvaṃ kartā dharaṇīdharaḥ // / //🔽tvaṃ hautram agnihotrāṇāṃ sūtramantrastvameva ca /
analyzed: tvam śreṣṭhaḥ sarva sattvānām tvam kartā dharaṇīdharaḥ  tvam hautram agnihotrāṇām sūtra mantraḥ tvam eva ca
translated: You are the best among all beings, you are the creator, the supporter of the earth.🔽You are the Hotra (priest) of the Agnihotra sacrifices, you are the mantra and the thread.

original: gokarṇaṃ bhadrakarṇaṃ ca tvaṃ ca māheśvaraṃ padam // / //
analyzed: gokarṇam bhadrakarṇam ca tvam ca māheśvaram padam
translated: You are Gokarna, Bhadrakarna, and you are the Mahesvara state.

analyzed: tvam kīrtiḥ sarva kīrtīnām dainya pāpa praṇāśinī
translated: You are the fame among all glories, the destroyer of misery and sin.

original: tvaṃ naimiṣaṃ kurukṣetraṃ tvaṃ ca viṣṇupadaṃ param // / //🔽tvayā tu līlayā deva padākrāntā ca medinī /
analyzed: tvam naimiṣam kurukṣetram tvam ca viṣṇupadam param  tvayā tu līlayā deva pada ākrāntā ca medinī
translated: You are Naimisha, Kurukshetra, and you are the supreme Vishnu-pada.🔽O Lord, you playfully covered the earth with your foot.

original: tvayā baddho balirdeva tvayendrasya padaṃ kṛtam // / //
analyzed: tvayā baddhaḥ baliḥ deva tvayā indrasya padam kṛtam
translated: O Lord, you bound Bali and gave Indra his position.

original: tvaṃ kalirdvāparaṃ deva tretā kṛtayugaṃ tathā /
analyzed: tvam kaliḥ dvāparam deva tretā kṛta yugam tathā
translated: You are Kali, Dvapara, and Treta, and also the golden age.

original: pralambadamanaśca tvaṃ sraṣṭā tvaṃ ca vināśakṛt // / //
analyzed: pralamba damanaḥ ca tvam sraṣṭā tvam ca vināśa kṛt
translated: You are the one who subdues Pralamba, you are the creator, and you are the one who brings about destruction.

original: tvayā vai dhāryate lokāstvaṃ kālaḥ sarvasaṃkṣayaḥ /
analyzed: tvayā vai dhāryate lokāḥ tvam kālaḥ sarva saṃkṣayaḥ
translated: The worlds are sustained by you, you are time, the destroyer of all.

original: tvayā hi deva sṛṣṭāstāḥ sarvā vai devayonayaḥ // / //
analyzed: tvayā hi deva sṛṣṭāḥ tāḥ sarvāḥ vai devayonayaḥ
translated: By you, O god, all the divine species have been created.

original: tvaṃ panthāḥ sarvalokānāṃ tvaṃ ca mokṣaḥ parā gatiḥ /
analyzed: tvam panthāḥ sarva lokānām tvam ca mokṣaḥ parā gatiḥ
translated: You are the path for all the worlds, you are liberation, the supreme goal.

analyzed: brahmā tvad udbhavaḥ devaḥ rajaḥ rūpaḥ sanātanaḥ
translated: Brahma, the god born from you, is the eternal form of rajas.

original: rudraḥ krodhodbhavo 'pyevaṃ tvaṃ ca sattve vyavasthitaḥ // / //
analyzed: rudraḥ krodha udbhavaḥ pi evam tvam ca sattve vyavasthitaḥ
translated: Rudra, born from anger, is also like that, and you are established in sattva.

analyzed: etat carācaram deva krīḍana artham tvayā kṛtam
translated: This world of moving and unmoving beings has been created by you for the sake of play.

original: evaṃ saṃtaptadehena stuto devo mayā prabhuḥ // / //
analyzed: evam saṃtapta dehena stutaḥ devaḥ mayā prabhuḥ
translated: Thus, the lord god was praised by me with a body heated by austerities.

analyzed: bhaktyā paramayā rājan sarva bhūta patiḥ prabhuḥ
translated: O king, the lord of all beings, the supreme lord,

analyzed: stuvan vai tatra paśyāmi vāri pūrṇān tatas ghaṭān
translated: while praising, I saw there pots filled with water.

original: tato mayā vismṛtā yā tṛṣā sā vardhitā punaḥ /
analyzed: tatas mayā vismṛtā yā tṛṣā sā vardhitā punar
translated: Then, the thirst that had been forgotten by me increased again.

original: upāsarpaṃ tatastasya pārśvaṃ vai puruṣasya hi // / //
analyzed: upāsarpam tatas tasya pārśvam vai puruṣasya hi
translated: Then I approached the side of that man.

original: pānīyaṃ pātukāmena cintitaṃ ca mayā punaḥ /
analyzed: pānīyam pātu kāmena cintitam ca mayā punar
translated: Desiring to drink water, I thought again:

original: nāpaśyata hi māṃ caiṣa supto 'pi na ca budhyate // / //
analyzed: na apaśyata hi mām ca eṣa suptaḥ na ca budhyate
translated: He did not see me, and even while asleep, he did not wake up.

original: yastu pāpena saṃmūḍhaḥ sukhaṃ suptaṃ prabodhayet /
analyzed: yaḥ tu pāpena saṃmūḍhaḥ sukham suptam prabodhayet
translated: He who, deluded by sin, awakens one sleeping happily,

analyzed: jāyate tasya pāpasya brahmahatyā phalam mahat
translated: For him is born the great fruit of the sin of Brahmanicide.

original: evaṃ saṃcintyamāne tu dvitīyo hyāgataḥ pumān /
analyzed: evam saṃcintyamāne tu dvitīyaḥ hi āgataḥ pumān
translated: While thus reflecting, a second man came.

analyzed: na īkṣate jalpate kiṃcid vāma skandhe
translated: He did not look or speak at all, but had a deer-skin on his left shoulder.

analyzed: jaṭī kamaṇḍalu dharaḥ daṇḍī mekhalayā vṛtaḥ
translated: He had matted hair, carried a water pot, a staff, and was surrounded by a girdle.

analyzed: bhasma unmṛdita sarva aṅgaḥ mahā tejāḥ trilocanaḥ
translated: His entire body was smeared with ashes, he had great splendor and three eyes.

original: yāvat taṃ stotukāmo 'ham apaśyaṃ svacchacakṣuṣā /🔽tāvat sarvāṅgasambhūtyāmahatyā rūpasampadā // / //
analyzed: yāvat tam stotu kāmaḥ ham apaśyam su accha cakṣuṣā  tāvat sarva aṅga sambhūtyā mahatyā rūpa sampadā
translated: When I, desiring to praise him, looked with clear eyes,🔽Then I saw a woman endowed with great beauty born from all limbs.

analyzed: apaśyam saṃvṛtām nārīm sarva ābharaṇa bhūṣitām
translated: I saw her covered, adorned with all ornaments.

original: dṛṣṭvā tāṃ patito bhūmau jayasveti bruvaṃstataḥ // / //
analyzed: dṛṣṭvā tām patitaḥ bhūmau jayasva iti bruvan tatas
translated: Seeing her, I fell to the ground and said, Be victorious!

original: jaya rudrāṅgasambhūte jayavāhini sanātani /🔽jaya kaumāri māhendri vaiṣṇavī vāruṇī tathā // / //
analyzed: jaya rudra aṅga sambhūte jayavāhini sanātani  jaya kaumāri māhendri vaiṣṇavī vāruṇī tathā
translated: Be victorious, O you born from Rudra's body! Be victorious, O eternal carrier!🔽Be victorious, O Kumari, Mahesvari, Vaishnavi, and Varuni!

original: jaya kauberi sāvitri jaya dhātri varānane /
analyzed: jaya kauberi sāvitri jaya dhātri varānane
translated: Be victorious, O Kuberi, Savitri, O nurse, O you of beautiful face!

original: tṛṣṇayā taptade hasya rakṣāṃ kuru carācare // / //
analyzed: tṛṣṇayā tapta de hasya rakṣām kuru carācare
translated: Protect the moving and unmoving world with compassion.

analyzed: śrī devī uvāca
translated: The Goddess said:

analyzed: prasannā vipra śārdūla tava vākyaiḥ su śobhanaiḥ
translated: O tiger among Brahmins, I am pleased with your very auspicious words.

original: vartate mānase yatte mayā jñātaṃ dvijottama // / //
analyzed: vartate mānase yat te mayā jñātam dvijottama
translated: O best of Brahmins, I know what is in your mind.

analyzed: śṛṇu vipra mama api asti vratam etat su dāruṇam
translated: Listen, O Brahmin, I too have this very terrible vow.

analyzed: strī laghu tvāt mayā ārabdham duṣkaram manda medhayā
translated: Due to the fickleness of a woman, I have begun this difficult task with slow intelligence.

original: yadi bhāvī ca me putro dharmiṣṭho lokaviśrutaḥ /
analyzed: yadi bhāvī ca me putraḥ dharmiṣṭhaḥ loka viśrutaḥ
translated: If a son is born to me who is righteous and famous in the world,

original: viprasya tu stanaṃ dattvā paścāddāsyāmi bālake // / //
analyzed: viprasya tu stanam dattvā paścāt dāsyāmi bālake
translated: then after giving the child the breast, I will give it to the Brahmin.

original: sa me putraḥ samutpanno yathokto me mahāmune /
analyzed: sa me putraḥ samutpannaḥ yathā uktaḥ me mahā mune
translated: O great sage, that son of mine has been born as described by you.

original: stanaṃ piba tvaṃ viprendra yadi jīvitumicchasi // / //
analyzed: stanam piba tvam vipra indra yadi jīvitum icchasi
translated: O Indra among Brahmins, if you wish to live, drink my breast milk.

analyzed: śrī mārkaṇḍeyaḥ uvāca
translated: The illustrious Markandeya said:

analyzed: akāryam etat viprāṇām yaḥ tu imam pibate stanam
translated: This is not the duty of Brahmins that he should drink this breast milk.

original: punaścaivopanayanaṃ vratasiddhiṃ na gacchati // / //🔽brāhmaṇatvaṃ tribhirlokairdurlabhaṃ padmalocane /
analyzed: punar ca eva upanayanam vrata siddhim na gacchati  brāhmaṇa tvam tribhiḥ lokaiḥ durlabham padma locane
translated: And he must be initiated again, he does not attain perfection in his vows.🔽O lotus-eyed one, Brahminhood is difficult to attain in the three worlds.

original: saṃskāraiḥ saṃskṛto vipro yaiśca jāyeta tacchṛṇu // / //
analyzed: saṃskāraiḥ saṃskṛtaḥ vipraḥ yaiḥ ca jāyeta tat śṛṇu
translated: Listen to the sacraments by which a Brahmin is born.

analyzed: prathamam ca eva nārīṣu saṃskāraiḥ
translated: And first, in the case of women, the impregnation by means of the sacraments.

analyzed: bīja prakṣepaṇāt eva bījakṣepaḥ saḥ ucyate
translated: The act of depositing the seed is called the seed-casting, from the very act of depositing the seed.

analyzed: tad ante ca mahābhāge garbhādhānam dvitīyakam
translated: And at the end of that, O highly blessed one, the second one is the garbhādhāna.

original: puṃsavanaṃ tṛtīyaṃ tu sīmantaṃ ca caturthakam // / //
analyzed: puṃsavanam tṛtīyam tu sīmantam ca caturthakam
translated: The puṃsavana is the third, and the sīmanta is the fourth.

analyzed: pañcamam jātakarma syāt nāma vai ṣaṣṭham ucyate
translated: The fifth should be the jātakarma, and the sixth is said to be the naming.

analyzed: niṣkrāmaḥ saptamaḥ ca eva hi annaprāśanam aṣṭamam
translated: The seventh is the niṣkrama, and the eighth is the annaprāśana.

analyzed: navamam vai cūḍa karma daśamam mauñjibandhanam
translated: The ninth is the cūḍākarman, and the tenth is the mouñjibandhana.

original: aiṣikaṃ dārvikaṃ caiva saumikaṃ bhaumikaṃ tathā // / //
analyzed: aiṣikam dārvikam ca eva saumikam bhaumikam tathā
translated: The aiṣika, dārvīka, saumika, and bhaumika,

analyzed: patnī saṃyojanam ca anyat daiva karma tatas param
translated: And another is the patnīsaṃyajana, and after that the daivaka rite.

analyzed: mānuṣyam pitṛ karma syāt daśama aṣṭāsu śobhane
translated: The human and the pitṛ rite should be performed in the ten and eight, O beautiful one.

original: bhūtaṃ bhavyaṃ tatheṣṭaṃ ca pārvaṇaṃ ca tataḥ param // / //
analyzed: bhūtam bhavyam tathā iṣṭam ca pārvaṇam ca tatas param
translated: The bhūta, bhavya, iṣṭa, and pārvaṇa, and after that,

analyzed: śrāddham śrāvaṇyām āgrayaṇam ca caitra āśvayujyām daśa paurṇamāsyām
translated: The śrāddha in Śrāvaṇa, the āgrayaṇa in Caitra and Āśvayuj, on the ten full moon days.

analyzed: nirūḍha paśu savana sautrāmaṇī agniṣṭoma atyagniṣṭomāḥ
translated: The nirūḍhapaśu, savana, sautrāmaṇi, agniṣṭoma, and atyāgniṣṭoma,

analyzed: ṣoḍaṣī vājapeya atirātra āptoryāma udaśa vājapeyāḥ
translated: The sixteen sacrifices, the Vajapeya, the Atiratra, the Aptoryama, the ten Vajapeyas,

analyzed: sarva bhūteṣu kṣāntiḥ anasūyā śauca maṅgalam akārpaṇyam aspṛhā iti
translated: Forbearance towards all beings, non-envy, purity, auspiciousness, non-stinginess, non-desire, etc.

original: ebhir aṣṭacatvāriṃśadbhiḥ saṃskāraiḥ saṃkṛto brāhmaṇo bhavati // / //
analyzed: ebhiḥ aṣṭacatvāriṃśadbhiḥ saṃskāraiḥ saṃkṛtaḥ brāhmaṇaḥ bhavati
translated: A Brahmin is purified by these thirty-eight sacraments.

original: evaṃ jñātvā mahābhāge na tu māṃ pātumarhasi /
analyzed: evam jñātvā mahābhāge na tu mām pātum arhasi
translated: Knowing this, O blessed one, you should not make me drink.

original: śiśupeyaṃ stanaṃ bhadre kathaṃ vai madvidhaḥ pibet // / //
analyzed: śiśu peyam stanam bhadre katham vai madvidhaḥ pibet
translated: O good one, how can one like me drink the milk meant for a child?

analyzed: mama etat vacanam śrutvā nārī vacanam abravīt
translated: Having heard these words of mine, the woman spoke these words:

original: yadi tvaṃ na pibeḥ stanyaṃ payo bālo mariṣyati /
analyzed: yadi tvam na pibeḥ stanyam payaḥ bālaḥ mariṣyati
translated: If you do not drink the breast milk, the child will die.

original: śrūyate triṣu lokeṣu vedeṣu ca smṛtiṣvapi /
analyzed: śrūyate triṣu lokeṣu vedeṣu ca smṛtiṣu api
translated: It is heard in the three worlds, in the Vedas and in the Smritis,

analyzed: mucyate sarva pāpebhyaḥ bhrūṇahatyāḥ na muñcati
translated: One is freed from all sins, but not from the sin of killing a fetus.

original: bhavitrī tava hatyā ca mahābhāgavataḥ punaḥ /
analyzed: bhavitrī tava hatyā ca mahā bhāgavataḥ punar
translated: And your killing will also be a great sin, O devotee of the Lord.

analyzed: janmāni ca śatāni aṣṭau kliśyate bhrūṇahatyayā
translated: For eight hundred births, one suffers from the sin of killing a fetus.

original: mṛtaḥ śunatvaṃ cāpnoti varṣāṇāṃ tu śatatrayam /
analyzed: mṛtaḥ śuna tvam ca āpnoti varṣāṇām tu śata trayam
translated: After death, one attains the state of a dog for three hundred years.

analyzed: tatas tasya kṣaye jāte kāka yonim vrajet punar
translated: When that is over, one goes again to the womb of a crow.

analyzed: tatra api ca śatāni aṣṭau kliśyate pāpa karmaṇi
translated: There also, for eight hundred years, he suffers for his sinful deeds.

original: varāho daśa janmāni tadante jāyate kṛmiḥ // / //
analyzed: varāhaḥ daśa janmāni tad ante jāyate kṛmiḥ
translated: Then for ten births as a boar, and at the end, birth as a worm.

analyzed: tatas ca ārohiṇīm prāpya go gaja aśva nṛ janma bhāj
translated: Then attaining the Aroruki state, he is born as a cow, elephant, horse, and man.

original: śrūyate śrutiśāstreṣu vedeṣu ca paraṃtapa // / //🔽sarvapāpādhikaṃ pāpaṃ bālahatyā dvijottama /
analyzed: śrūyate śruti śāstreṣu vedeṣu ca paraṃtapa  sarva pāpa adhikam pāpam bāla hatyā dvijottama
translated: O scorcher of enemies, it is heard in the scriptures and Vedas.🔽O best of Brahmins, the sin of killing a child is greater than all other sins.

analyzed: bāla hatyā yutaḥ vipraḥ pacyate narake dhruvam
translated: A Brahmin who has killed ten children certainly roasts in hell.

analyzed: varṣāṇi ca śatāni aṣṭau prāpnoti yama yātanām
translated: For eight hundred years, he suffers the tortures of Yama.

original: tasmādalpataro doṣaḥ pibato me stanaṃ tava // / //
analyzed: tasmāt alpataraḥ doṣaḥ pibataḥ me stanam tava
translated: Therefore, the sin of drinking your breast milk is less.

analyzed: tathā eva apibataḥ pāpam jāyate bahu varṣikam
translated: Similarly, the sin of not drinking it is for many years.

analyzed: kṣudhā tṛṣā virāmaḥ te puṇyam ca pibataḥ stanam
translated: For you, there is no cessation of hunger and thirst while drinking my breast milk.

original: ato na cetaḥ saṃdigdhaṃ kartavyamiha karhicit /
analyzed: atas na ca itas saṃdigdham kartavyam iha karhicit
translated: Therefore, the mind should never doubt what should be done here.

original: ehi vipra yathākāmaṃ bālārthe piba me stanam // / //
analyzed: ehi vipra yathākāmam bāla arthe piba me stanam
translated: Come, O Brahmin, as you wish, drink my breast milk for the child's sake.

original: tato 'haṃ vacanaṃ śrutvā stanaṃ pātuṃ samudyataḥ /
analyzed: tatas ham vacanam śrutvā stanam pātum samudyataḥ
translated: Then, hearing those words, I was ready to drink the breast milk.

original: na ca tṛptiṃ vijānāmi pibataḥ stanamuttamam // / //
analyzed: na ca tṛptim vijānāmi pibataḥ stanam uttamam
translated: But I did not feel satisfied while drinking that excellent breast milk.

analyzed: triṃśat varṣa sahasrāṇi bhārata evam śatāni ca
translated: For thirty thousand years and three hundred years, O Bharata, I remained in that state.

analyzed: tatas prabuddha utsaṅge haṃ māyā nidrā vimohitaḥ
translated: Then, awakened, I found myself on the lap of Maya, deluded by the sleep of illusion.

analyzed: nidrā vigata mohaḥ ham yāvat paśyāmi pāṇḍava
translated: O Pandava, when I was free from the delusion of sleep,

original: tāvatsuptaṃ na paśyāmi na ca taṃ bālakaṃ vibho // / //
analyzed: tāvat suptam na paśyāmi na ca tam bālakam vibho
translated: I saw that neither the sleeping one nor the child was there, O lord.

original: caturastāṃśca vai kumbhān paśyāmi tatra bhārata /
analyzed: caturaḥ tān ca vai kumbhān paśyāmi tatra bhārata
translated: I saw the four pots there, O Bharata.

original: na ca paśyāmi tāṃ devīṃ gatā vai kutracicca te // / //
analyzed: na ca paśyāmi tām devīm gatāḥ vai kutracid ca te
translated: But I did not see the goddess, who had gone somewhere.

analyzed: evam vimṛśyamānasya cintayānasya tiṣṭhataḥ
translated: While I was reflecting thus, thinking, and standing,

analyzed: īṣat hasitayā vācā devī vacanam abravīt
translated: the goddess spoke these words with a slight smile.

analyzed: śrī devī uvāca
translated: The goddess said:

original: kṛṣṇaḥ sa puruṣaḥ supto dvitīyo 'pyāgato haraḥ /
analyzed: kṛṣṇaḥ sa puruṣaḥ suptaḥ dvitīyaḥ pi āgataḥ haraḥ
translated: The sleeping Krishna is the Supreme Being, and the second one who came is Shiva.

original: ye catvāraśca te kumbhāḥ samudrāste dvijottama // / //
analyzed: ye catvāraḥ ca te kumbhāḥ samudrāḥ te dvijottama
translated: O best of Brahmins, the four pots are the four oceans.

analyzed: yaḥ ca bālaḥ tvayā dṛṣṭaḥ brāhmāḥ lokapitāmahaḥ
translated: The child you saw is Brahma, the grandfather of the worlds.

original: ahaṃ ca pṛthivī jñeyā saptadvīpā sarvatā // / //
analyzed: aham ca pṛthivī jñeyā sapta dvīpā sarvatā
translated: I should be known as the earth with its seven islands and everything.

original: yā gatā tvāṃ parityajya bhūtale supratiṣṭhitā /
analyzed: yā gatā tvām parityajya bhū tale su pratiṣṭhitā
translated: She who left you and is well-established on the ground,

original: imāṃ ca prekṣase vipra narmadāṃ saritāṃ varām // / //
analyzed: imām ca prekṣase vipra narmadām saritām varām
translated: and you see this Narmada, the best of rivers, O Brahmin.

analyzed: sarva sattva upakārāya bṛhate puṇya lakṣaṇā
translated: For the benefit of all beings, having great merits,

original: revānadī tu vikhyātā na mṛtā tena narmadā // / //
analyzed: revā nadī tu vikhyātā na mṛtā tena narmadā
translated: The river Revā is well-known, and since she did not die, she is called Narmadā.

translated: But on the sixth day, she who always gives the fruit of Madhuka,

analyzed: tasyāḥ putraḥ yathā skandaḥ deva saṅgheṣu ca uttamaḥ
translated: Just as Skanda, her son, is the best among the hosts of gods,

analyzed: utpadyate mahā rājaḥ sarva lokeṣu pūjitaḥ

analyzed: saptamyām yā dvijaśreṣṭham suvarṇena prapūjayet
translated: On the seventh day, she who worships the best of Brahmins with gold,

analyzed: uddiśya jagataḥ nātham devadevam divākaram
translated: Having offered to the lord of the world, the god of gods, the sun,

analyzed: tasya puṇya phalam yat vai kathitam dvijasattamaiḥ
translated: The fruits of her merit, which have been described by the best of Brahmins,

analyzed: tat te rājñi pravakṣyāmi śṛṇuṣva ekamanāḥ sati
translated: O queen, I will tell you that. Listen with a focused mind.

analyzed: dadrū citraka kuṣṭhāni maṇḍalāni vicarcikā
translated: Leprosy, white leprosy, and other skin diseases, circular rashes, and scabs,

analyzed: na bhavanti iha ca aṅgeṣu pūrva karma arjitāni api
translated: Do not appear on her body, even if earned from past karma.

original: kṛṣṇāṃ dhenuṃ tathāṣṭamyāṃ yā prayacchati bhāminī // / //
analyzed: kṛṣṇām dhenum tathā aṣṭamyām yā prayacchati bhāminī
translated: And the beautiful woman who gives a black cow on the eighth day,

analyzed: brāhmaṇe vṛtta sampanne prīyatām me maheśvaraḥ
translated: To a Brahmin who is endowed with good conduct, May Mahesvara be pleased with me.

analyzed: tasyāḥ janma arjitam pāpam naśyate vibhava anvitā
translated: Her sins earned from birth are destroyed, she becomes prosperous,

analyzed: jāyate na atra sandehaḥ yasmāt dānam anuttamam
translated: There is no doubt about this, because that gift is supreme.

original: gandhadhūpaṃ tu yā nārī bhaktyā viprāya dāpayet // / //
analyzed: gandha dhūpam tu yā nārī bhaktyā viprāya dāpayet
translated: The woman who offers fragrant incense to a Brahmin with devotion,

analyzed: kātyāyanīm samuddiśya navamyām śṛṇu yat phalam
translated: Listen to the fruit that is obtained by offering it to Katyayani on the ninth day.

original: tasyā bhrātā pitā putraḥ patirvā raṇamuttamam // / //
analyzed: tasyāḥ bhrātā pitā putraḥ patiḥ vā raṇam uttamam
translated: Her brother, father, son or husband, having reached the excellent battle,

analyzed: prāpyate na eva sīdanti tena dānena rakṣitāḥ
translated: are not afflicted, being protected by that gift.

analyzed: ikṣu daṇḍa rasam devi daśamyām yā prayacchati
translated: O Goddess, she who offers the juice of sugarcane on the tenth day,

analyzed: lokapālān samuddiśya brāhmaṇe vyaṅga varjite
translated: to the guardians of the world, in a brahmin free from deformities,

original: tena dānena sā nityaṃ sarvalokasya vallabhā // / //
analyzed: tena dānena sā nityam sarva lokasya vallabhā
translated: by that gift, she always becomes dear to all the people.

analyzed: jāyate na atra sandehaḥ iti evam śaṅkaraḥ bravīt
translated: There is no doubt about this, thus said Shankara.

analyzed: ekādaśyām upoṣya atha dvādaśyām udaka pradā
translated: Having fasted on the eleventh day, she who offers water on the twelfth day,

analyzed: nārāyaṇam samuddiśya brāhmaṇe viṣṇu tatpare
translated: to Narayana, in a brahmin devoted to Vishnu,

analyzed: sā sadā sparśa sambhāṣaiḥ drāvayet bhāvayet janam
translated: she always melts and delights people by her touch and conversation.

original: yasmāddānaṃ maharloke hyanantam udake bhavet /🔽pādābhyaṅgaṃ śiro'bhyaṅgaṃ kāmamuddiśya vai dvije // / //
analyzed: yasmāt dānam mahar loke hi anantam udake bhavet  pāda abhyaṅgam śiraḥ abhyaṅgam kāmam uddiśya vai dvije
translated: Because the gift in the world of Mahar is endless, it becomes so in water.

analyzed: dadāti ca trayodaśyām bhaktyā paramayā aṅganā
translated: The woman who, with great devotion, offers foot massage and head massage on the thirteenth day,

original: yasyāṃ yasyāṃ mṛtā jāyed bhūyo yonyāṃ tu janmani // / //
analyzed: yasyām yasyām mṛtā jāyet bhūyas yonyām tu janmani
translated: to a brahmin, with desire, in whatever womb she is born again after death,🔽she becomes a woman with all the limbs complete, endowed with beauty and youth.

original: tasyāṃ tasyāṃ tu sā bharturna viyujyeta karhicit /
analyzed: tasyām tasyām tu sā bhartuḥ na viyujyeta karhicit
translated: She should never be separated from her husband in any situation.

analyzed: tathā api evam caturdaśyām dadyāt pātram upānahau
translated: Thus, on the fourteenth day, one should offer a vessel, shoes, etc.

analyzed: brahmaṇe dharmam uddiśya tasyāḥ lokāḥ hi anāmayāḥ
translated: To Brahma, with Dharma in mind, her worlds are free from disease.

original: evaṃ ca pakṣapakṣānte śrāddhe tarped dvijottamān // / //
analyzed: evam ca pakṣa pakṣa ante śrāddhe dvijottamān
translated: Thus, at the end of each fortnight, one should satisfy the best of Brahmins in the ancestral offering, etc.

original: avyucchinnā sadā rājñi santatir jāyate bhuvi /
analyzed: avyucchinnā sadā rājñi santatiḥ jāyate bhuvi
translated: O queen! The lineage is always unbroken on earth.

analyzed: evam te tithi māhātmyam dāna yogena bhāṣitam
translated: Thus, the greatness of the lunar days has been told to you along with the yoga of giving, etc.

original: tathā vanaspatīnāṃ tu ārādhanavidhiṃ śṛṇu /🔽jambūṃ nimbataruṃ caiva tindukaṃ madhukaṃ tathā // / //🔽āmraṃ cāmalakaṃ caiva śālmaliṃ vaṭapippalau /
analyzed: tathā vanaspatīnām tu ārādhana vidhim śṛṇu  jambūm nimba tarum ca eva tindukam madhukam tathā  āmram ca āmalakam ca eva śālmalim vaṭa pippalau
translated: Listen to the method of propitiating the trees.🔽Approaching the Jambu tree, the Nimba tree, the Tinduka tree, the Madhuka tree, etc.,

analyzed: kadalīm pāṭalīm tathā
translated: The mango tree, the Emblic myrobalan tree, the Shami tree, the Bilva tree, the Amla tree, the plantain tree, the Patali tree, etc.,

analyzed: anyān puṇyatamān vṛkṣān upetya svargam āpnuyāt
translated: And other most sacred trees, one attains heaven.

analyzed: nāradaḥ uvāca
translated: Narada said:

original: caitre māse tu yā nārī kuryādvratamanuttamam /
analyzed: caitre māse tu yā nārī kuryāt vratam anuttamam
translated: In the month of Chaitra, a woman who observes this excellent vow,

original: tasya vratasya cānyāni kalāṃ nārhanti ṣoḍaśīm // / //
analyzed: tasya vratasya ca anyāni kalām na arhanti ṣoḍaśīm
translated: The other vows do not deserve even a sixteenth part of that vow.

original: śrutena yena subhage durbhagatvaṃ na paśyati /
analyzed: śrutena yena subhage durbhaga tvam na paśyati
translated: O beautiful one! By which (vow) one does not see misfortune.

original: yathā himaṃ raviṃ prāpya vilayaṃ yāti bhūtale // / //
analyzed: yathā himam ravim prāpya vilayam yāti bhū tale
translated: Just as snow, upon reaching the sun, melts on the ground,

analyzed: tathā duḥkham ca daurbhāgyam vratāt asmāt vilīyate
translated: so does suffering and misfortune melt away from this vow.

analyzed: madhukā ākhyām tu lalitām ārādhayati yena vai
translated: One who worships the beloved known as Madhu,

original: vidhiṃ taṃ śṛṇu subhage kathyamānaṃ sukhāvaham /
analyzed: vidhim tam śṛṇu subhage kathyamānam sukha āvaham
translated: listen to that method, O fortunate one, as it is being told, which brings happiness.

analyzed: caitre śukla tṛtīyāyām su snātā śuddha mānasā
translated: On the third day of the bright fortnight in Chaitra, having bathed well with a pure mind,

analyzed: pratimām madhu vṛkṣasya śāṅkarīm umayā saha
translated: one should make an image of the Madhu tree, of Shankara with Uma,

analyzed: kārayitvā dvijavaraiḥ pratiṣṭhāpya yathāvidhi
translated: having caused it to be made by excellent Brahmins and having installed it according to the prescribed method,

analyzed: sugandhi kusumaiḥ dhūpaiḥ tathā karpūra kuṅkumaiḥ
translated: with fragrant flowers, incense, and also with camphor and saffron,

analyzed: pūjayet vidhinā devam mantra yuktena bhāminī
translated: the beautiful lady should worship the Lord with mantras according to the rules.

original: pādau namaḥ śivāyeti meḍhre vai manmathāya ca /
analyzed: pādau namaḥ śivāya iti meḍhre vai manmathāya ca
translated: One should offer salutations to the feet with Salutations to Shiva, to the genitals with To Manmatha,

analyzed: nīlakaṃṭhāya kaṇṭhakam
translated: to the belly with To Kalodara, to the throat with To Nilakantha,

analyzed: śiraḥ sarvātmane pūjya umām paścāt prapūjayet
translated: having worshipped the head as To Sarvatma, one should then worship Uma.

analyzed: sukaṇṭhāyai ca kaṇṭhakam
translated: To the belly with To Kshamodara, to the throat with To Sukantha,

analyzed: śiraḥ saubhāgya dāyinyai paścāt arghyam pradāpayet
translated: to the head of the bestower of conjugal bliss, one should then offer Arghya.

analyzed: namaḥ te devadeveśaḥ umā vara jagatpate
translated: Salutations to you, O Lord of the gods of gods, O consort of Uma, O Lord of the universe.

original: arghyeṇānena me sarvaṃ daurbhāgyaṃ nāśaya prabho /
analyzed: arghyeṇa anena me sarvam daurbhāgyam nāśaya prabho
translated: With this Arghya, O Lord, destroy all my misfortune.

analyzed: iti arghya mantraḥ
translated: Thus is the Arghya Mantra.

original: arghyaṃ dattvā tataḥ paścātkarakaṃ vāripūritam /🔽madhūkapātropabhṛtaṃ sahiraṇyaṃ tu śaktitaḥ // / //
analyzed: arghyam dattvā tatas paścāt karakam vāri pūritam  madhūka pātra upabhṛtam sa hiraṇyam tu śaktitas
translated: Having offered the Arghya, then afterwards the pot filled with water,🔽Filled with a Madhuka vessel, along with gold according to one's ability.

analyzed: karakam vāri sampūrṇam saubhāgyena tu saṃyutam
translated: The pot filled with water, along with good fortune,

analyzed: dattam tu lalite tubhyam saubhāgya ādi vivardhanam
translated: Is offered to you, O Lalita, for increasing good fortune and so on.

analyzed: iti karaka dāna mantraḥ
translated: Thus is the mantra for giving the pot.

original: mantreṇānena viprāya dadyāt karakamuttamam /🔽lavaṇaṃ varjayec chuklāṃ yāvadanyāṃ tṛtīyikām // / //
analyzed: mantreṇa anena viprāya dadyāt karakam uttamam  lavaṇam varjayet śuklām yāvat anyām tṛtīyikām
translated: With this mantra, one should give the excellent pot to a Brahmin,🔽Avoiding salt until the next third lunar day of the bright fortnight.

original: kṣamāpya devīṃ deveśāṃ naktam adyātsvayaṃ haviḥ /
analyzed: kṣamāpya devīm deva īśām naktam adyāt svayam haviḥ
translated: Having appeased the Goddess and the Lord of the gods, one should eat one's own oblations at night.

original: anena vidhinā sārdhaṃ māsi māsi hy apakramet // / //
analyzed: anena vidhinā sārdham māsi māsi hi apakramet
translated: By this method, one should observe this every month.

original: phālgunasya tṛtīyāyāṃ śuklāyāṃ tu samāpyate /🔽vaiśākhe lavaṇaṃ deyaṃ jyeṣṭhe cājyaṃ pradīyate // / //
analyzed: phālgunasya tṛtīyāyām śuklāyām tu samāpyate  vaiśākhe lavaṇam deyam jyeṣṭhe ca ājyam pradīyate
translated: It is completed on the third lunar day of the bright fortnight of Phalguni.🔽In Vaishakha, salt should be given, and ghee is offered in Jyeshtha.

original: āṣāḍhe māsi niṣpāvāḥ payo deyaṃ tu śrāvaṇe /
analyzed: āṣāḍhe māsi niṣpāvāḥ payaḥ deyam tu śrāvaṇe
translated: In the month of Ashadha, beans are offered, and milk is offered in Shravana.

original: mudgā deyā nabhasye tu śālimāśvayuje tathā // / //
analyzed: mudgāḥ deyāḥ nabhasye tu śālim āśvayuje tathā
translated: Mudga beans should be given in Nabhasya, and Shali rice in Ashvayuja.

original: kārttike śarkarāpātraṃ karakaṃ rasasaṃbhṛtam /🔽mārgaśīrṣe tu kārpāsaṃ karakaṃ ghṛtasaṃyutam // / //🔽pauṣe tu kuṅkumaṃ deyaṃ māghe pātraṃ tilair bhṛtam /
analyzed: kārttike śarkarā pātram karakam rasa saṃbhṛtam  mārgaśīrṣe tu kārpāsam karakam ghṛta saṃyutam  pauṣe tu kuṅkumam deyam māghe pātram tilaiḥ bhṛtam
translated: In Kartika, a vessel filled with sugar and a pot filled with juice,🔽In Margashirsha, cotton and a pot filled with ghee,🔽In Pausha, saffron should be given, and in Magha, a vessel filled with sesame seeds.

analyzed: phālgune māsi samprāpte pātram modaka saṃbhṛtam
translated: When the month of Phalguna arrives, a vessel filled with modakas (sweet dumplings),

analyzed: paścāt tṛtīyā deyam yat tat pūrvasyām vivarjayet
translated: After that, what is to be given on the third day should be avoided on the previous day.

analyzed: vidhānam āsām sarvāsām sāmānyam manasaḥ priye
translated: The general rule for all of them is dear to the mind.

analyzed: pratimām madhu vṛkṣasya tām eva pratipūjayet
translated: One should worship that very image of the Madhu tree.

original: tasmai sarvaṃ tu viprāya ācāryāya pradīyate // / //
analyzed: tasmai sarvam tu viprāya ācāryāya pradīyate
translated: To that very Brahmin teacher, everything is given.

analyzed: tatas saṃvatsarasya ante udyāpana vidhim śṛṇu
translated: Then, at the end of the year, listen to the method of concluding the vow.

analyzed: madhu vṛkṣam tatas gatvā bahu sambhāra saṃvṛtaḥ
translated: Then, having gone to the Madhu tree, surrounded by many offerings,

analyzed: nikhanet pratimām madhye mādhūkīm madhukasya ca
translated: One should bury in the middle the image of the Madhuka tree.

analyzed: tatrastham pūjayet sarvam umā deha arddha dhāriṇam
translated: There, one should worship everything, the one who bears Uma as half of his body,

analyzed: pūjā upahāraiḥ vipulaiḥ kuṅkumena punar punar
translated: Again and again, with extensive offerings of worship and with saffron.

analyzed: ślakṣṇābhiḥ puṣpa mālābhiḥ kausumbhaiḥ kesareṇa ca
translated: With smooth flower garlands and saffron filaments.

analyzed: kausumbhe vāsasī śubhre atasī puṣpa sannibhe
translated: Wearing auspicious saffron garments resembling the color of flax flowers,

original: paridhāpya tāṃ pratimāṃ dampatī ravisaṃkhyayā // / //🔽upānadyugalaiśchatraiḥ kaṇṭhasūtraiḥ sakaṇṭhikaiḥ /
analyzed: paridhāpya tām pratimām dampatī ravi saṃkhyayā  upānah yugalaiḥ chatraiḥ kaṇṭha sūtraiḥ sa kaṇṭhikaiḥ
translated: The couple should dress the image with the number of suns (i.e. 12).🔽With pairs of sandals, umbrellas, necklaces with pendants,

analyzed: kaṭakaiḥ aṅgulīyaiḥ ca śayanīyaiḥ śubha āstṛtaiḥ
translated: Bracelets, rings, and auspicious beddings,

analyzed: kuṅkumena vilipta aṅgau bahu puṣpaiḥ ca pūjitau
translated: Their bodies anointed with saffron and worshipped with many flowers,

analyzed: bhojayet vividhaiḥ ratnaiḥ madhūka āvāsake sthitau
translated: They should be fed with various jewels, remaining in a room perfumed with jasmine.

original: bhuktotthitau tu viśrāmya śayyāsu ca kṣamāpayet /
analyzed: bhukta utthitau tu viśrāmya śayyāsu ca kṣamāpayet
translated: Having eaten, they should rest and be excused from the beds.

analyzed: guru mūlam yatas sarvam guruḥ jñeyaḥ maheśvaraḥ
translated: Since everything has the guru as its root, the guru should be known as Mahesvara.

original: prīte gurau tataḥ sarvaṃ jagatprītaṃ surāsuram /
analyzed: prīte gurau tatas sarvam jagat prītam sura asuram
translated: When the guru is pleased, then the entire world, with gods and demons, is pleased.

analyzed: yat yat iṣṭatamam loke yat kiṃcid dayitam gṛhe
translated: Whatever is most desired in the world, whatever is dear in the house,

analyzed: tat sarvam gurave deyam ātmanaḥ śreyaḥ icchatā
translated: All that should be given to the guru by one who desires his own welfare.

original: idaṃ tu dhanibhir deyamanyair deyaṃ yathocyate // / //
analyzed: idam tu dhanibhiḥ deyam anyaiḥ deyam yathā ucyate
translated: This should be given by the wealthy, and by others as stated.

analyzed: dāmpatyam ekam vidhivat pratipūjya śubha vrataiḥ
translated: The couple should be duly worshipped by those of auspicious vows.

analyzed: dvitīyam guru dāmpatyam vitta śāṭhyam vivarjayet
translated: The second guru couple should be worshipped, and stinginess in wealth should be avoided.

original: tataḥ kṣamāpayeddevīṃ devaṃ ca brāhmaṇaṃ gurum /
analyzed: tatas kṣamāpayet devīm devam ca brāhmaṇam gurum
translated: Then the goddess and the god, the brahmin guru, should be requested for forgiveness.

original: yathā tvaṃ devi lalite na viyuktāsi śambhunā // / //
analyzed: yathā tvam devi lalite na viyuktā asi śambhunā
translated: Just as you, O goddess Lalita, are never separated from Shambhu,

analyzed: tathā me pati putrāṇām aviyogaḥ pradīyatām
translated: so grant me the boon of never being separated from my husband and sons.

analyzed: anena vidhinā kṛtvā tṛtīyām madhu saṃjñikām
translated: Having performed the third Madhu-named Tithi in this manner,

analyzed: indrāṇī ca indra patnī tvam avāpa sutam uttamam
translated: Indrani, the wife of Indra, attained the status of being Indra's wife and an excellent son.

analyzed: saubhāgyam sarva lokeṣu sarva ṛddhi sukham uttamam
translated: Good fortune in all the worlds, all prosperity and excellent happiness,

original: anena vidhinā yā tu kumārī vratamācaret /
analyzed: anena vidhinā yā tu kumārī vratam ācaret
translated: One who observes this vow in this manner,

analyzed: śobhanam patim āpnoti yathā indrāṇyā śatakratuḥ
translated: obtains an auspicious husband, just as Shatakratu obtained Indra's wife.

original: durbhagā subhagatvaṃ ca subhagā putriṇī bhavet /
analyzed: durbhagā subhaga tvam ca subhagā putriṇī bhavet
translated: An unfortunate woman becomes fortunate and a fortunate woman becomes endowed with sons.

analyzed: putriṇī akṣayam āpnoti na śokam paśyati kvacid
translated: An endowed with sons attains immortality and never sees sorrow anywhere.

analyzed: aneka janma janitam daurbhāgyam naśyati dhruvam
translated: The misfortune accumulated over many births certainly perishes.

original: mṛtā tu tridivaṃ prāpya umayā saha modate // / //
analyzed: mṛtā tu tridivam prāpya umayā saha modate
translated: Having died and attained heaven, she rejoices with Uma.

analyzed: kalpa koṭi śatam sāgram bhuktvā bhogān yathā īpsitān
translated: For more than a hundred crore of kalpas, she enjoys desired pleasures,

original: punastu sambhave loke pārthivaṃ patim āpnuyāt // / //
analyzed: punar tu sambhave loke pārthivam patim āpnuyāt
translated: and again, when the world is re-established, she would obtain a king as her husband.

analyzed: subhagā rūpa sampannā pārthivam janayet sutam
translated: She would be fortunate, endowed with beauty, and give birth to a son who would be a king.

analyzed: etat te kathitam sarvam vratānām uttamam vratam
translated: I have told you all this, the best of vows.

analyzed: anyat pṛcchasva subhage vāñchitam yat hṛdi sthitam
translated: Ask me another thing, O fortunate one, whatever is in your heart.

original: iti śrīskānde mahāpurāṇa ekāśītisāhasryāṃ saṃhitāyāṃ pañcama āvantyakhaṇḍe revākhaṇḍe narmadāmāhātmye madhūkatṛtīyāvratavidhānamāhātmyavarṇanaṃ
analyzed: iti śrī skānde mahāpurāṇe ekāśīti sāhasryām saṃhitāyām pañcame āvantya khaṇḍe revākhaṇḍe narmadāmāhātmye madhūkatṛtīyāvrata vidhāna māhātmya varṇanam
translated: Thus ends the description of the Madhuka-Tṛtīyā Vrata procedure and greatness, in the Narmadā-Māhātmya of the fifth Āvantaya Khaṇḍa of the Skanda Mahāpurāṇa, consisting of eighty-one thousand verses.

analyzed: nāma ṣaḍviṃśaḥ dhyāyaḥ
translated: Name of the twenty-sixth chapter.

analyzed: rku adhyāya
translated: The chapter on the Sun

analyzed: śrī mārkaṇḍeyaḥ uvāca
translated: Śrī Mārkaṇḍeya said:

original: nāradasya vacaḥ śrutvā rājñī vacanam abravīt /
analyzed: nāradasya vacaḥ śrutvā rājñī vacanam abravīt
translated: Having heard the words of Nārada, the queen spoke these words:

original: prasādaṃ kuru viprendra gṛhṇa dānaṃ yathepsitam // / //
analyzed: prasādam kuru vipra indra gṛhṇa dānam yathā īpsitam
translated: Be gracious, O lord of brahmins, accept the gift as desired.

analyzed: suvarṇa maṇi ratnāni vastrāṇi vividhāni ca
translated: Gold, gems, jewels, and various kinds of garments,

analyzed: kācid suptā viśāla akṣī hāra āvali vibhūṣitā
translated: And some, having wide eyes, adorned with necklaces,

analyzed: dhūmena ākulitā dīnā nyapatat havyavāhane
translated: were choked with smoke, miserable, and fell into the sacrificial fire.

analyzed: kācid tasmin pure dīpte putra sneha anulālasā
translated: And some, in that burning city, out of affection for their sons,

analyzed: putram āliṅgate gāḍham dahyate tripure gninā
translated: embraced their sons closely and were burnt by the fire of Tripura.

analyzed: kācid kanaka varṇa ābhā indranīla vibhūṣitā
translated: Some, having the lustre of gold and adorned with sapphires,

original: bhartāraṃ patitaṃ dṛṣṭvā patitā tasya copari // / //
analyzed: bhartāram patitam dṛṣṭvā patitā tasya ca upari
translated: seeing their husband fallen, fell down on him.

original: kācidādityavarṇābhā prasuptā tu priyopari /🔽agnijvālāhatā gāḍhaṃ kaṃṭhamāliṅgate nṛpa // / //
analyzed: kācid āditya varṇa ābhā prasuptā tu priyā upari  agni jvālā āhatā gāḍham kaṃṭham āliṅgate nṛpa
translated: Some, having the lustre of the sun, were sleeping on their beloved,🔽deeply embracing his neck, struck by the flames of fire.

analyzed: medha varṇā parā nārī calat kanaka mekhalā
translated: Another woman, having the complexion of a cloud, with a moving golden girdle,

analyzed: śveta vastra uttarīyā tu papāta dharaṇī tale
translated: with a white upper garment, fell down on the ground.

analyzed: kācid kunda indu varṇa ābhā nīla ratna vibhūṣitā
translated: Some, having the lustre of jasmine and the moon, adorned with blue gems,

analyzed: śirasā prāñjaliḥ bhūtvā vijñāpayati pāvakam
translated: with her head bowed down, joined palms, and addressed the fire.

analyzed: kasyāścid jvalate vastram keśāḥ kasyāḥ ca bhārata
translated: The garment of some was burning, O descendant of Bharata, and the hair of some,

analyzed: jvalat jvalana saṅkāśaiḥ ca  kācid prabhūta duḥkha ārtā vilalāpa vara aṅganā
translated: together with golden ornaments resembling blazing fire.🔽Some excellent woman, afflicted with great sorrow, lamented,

original: bhasmībhūtaṃ patiṃ dṛṣṭvā krandantī kurarī yathā // / //
analyzed: bhasmībhūtam patim dṛṣṭvā krandantī kurarī yathā
translated: seeing her husband reduced to ashes, crying like a female osprey.

original: āliṅgya gāḍhaṃ sahasā patitā tasya mūrdhani /
analyzed: āliṅgya gāḍham sahasā patitā tasya mūrdhani
translated: Suddenly embracing him tightly, she fell down on his head.

analyzed: kācid ca bahu duḥkha ārtā vyalapat strī sva veśmani
translated: And some woman, afflicted with great sorrow, lamented in her own house.

original: bhasmasācca kṛtaṃ dṛṣṭvā krandate kurarī yathā /
analyzed: bhasmasāt ca kṛtam dṛṣṭvā krandate kurarī yathā
translated: Seeing her husband reduced to ashes, she wails like a female osprey.

analyzed: mātaram pitaram kācid dṛṣṭvā vigata cetanam
translated: Some, seeing their mother or father bereft of consciousness,

original: vepate patitā bhūmau kheditā vaḍavā yathā /
analyzed: vepate patitā bhūmau kheditā vaḍavā yathā
translated: tremble and fall to the ground, lamenting like a mare.

analyzed: itas ca itas ca kācid ca dahyamānā vara aṅganā
translated: Some, burning here and there, the beautiful women

analyzed: na apaśyat bālam utsaṅge viparīta mukhī sthitā
translated: did not see the child on their lap, their faces turned away.

analyzed: kumbhilasya gṛham dagdham patitam dharaṇī tale
translated: Kumbhila's house was burnt and fell to the ground.

original: kūṣmāṇḍasya ca dhūmrasya kuhakasya bakasya ca /
analyzed: kūṣmāṇḍasya ca dhūmrasya kuhakasya bakasya ca
translated: The houses of Kumbhanda, Dhumra, Kuhaka, Baka,

analyzed: virūpa nayanasya api virūpākṣasya ca eva hi
translated: Virupananayana, and Virupaksha,

analyzed: śumbhaḥ ḍimbhaḥ ca raudraḥ ca prahlādaḥ ca asura uttamaḥ
translated: Sumbha, Dimbha, the fierce one, and Prahlada, the best of demons,

analyzed: daṇḍapāṇiḥ vipāṇiḥ ca siṃhavaktraḥ tathā anagha
translated: Dandapani, Vipani, the sinless one with a lion's face,

analyzed: dundubhaḥ ca eva saṃhrādaḥ ḍiṇḍiḥ muṇḍiḥ tathā eva ca
translated: Dundubhi, Samhrada, Dindi, and Mundhi,

analyzed: bāṇa bhrātā ca bāṇaḥ ca kravyāda vyāghravaktrakau
translated: Bana's brother Bana, and those with faces of carnivorous beasts and tigers,

analyzed: evam anye ye kecid dānavāḥ bala darpitāḥ
translated: and others who were proud of their strength,

original: teṣāṃ gṛhe tathā vahnirjvalate nirdayo nṛpa /
analyzed: teṣām gṛhe tathā vahniḥ jvalate nirdayaḥ nṛpa
translated: their houses were also burnt by the fire, O king.

analyzed: dahyamānāḥ striyaḥ tāta vilapanti gṛhe gṛhe
translated: O son, the women, being burnt, are lamenting in every house.

analyzed: karuṇā akṣara vādinyaḥ nirādhārāḥ gatāḥ śivam
translated: The women, speaking words of compassion, being helpless, have gone to Shiva.

original: yadi vairaṃ surāreśca puruṣoparipāvaka // / //🔽striyaḥ kimaparādhyanti gṛhapañjarakokilāḥ /
analyzed: yadi vairam surāreḥ ca puruṣa upari pāvaka  striyaḥ kim aparādhyanti gṛha pañjara kokilāḥ
translated: If there is enmity between the lord of gods and the fire on men,🔽why do the women, the cuckoos in the cage of the house, offend?

original: anirdayo nṛśaṃsastvaṃ kaste kopaḥ striyaṃ prati // / //
analyzed: anirdayaḥ nṛśaṃsaḥ tvam kaḥ te kopaḥ striyam prati
translated: You are merciless and cruel. What anger do you have towards women?

original: kiṃ tvayā na śrutaṃ loke avadhyāḥ sarvathā striyaḥ /
analyzed: kim tvayā na śrutam loke avadhyāḥ sarvathā striyaḥ
translated: Have you not heard in the world that women should never be killed?

original: kiṃ tu tubhyaṃ guṇo hyasti dahane pavaneritaḥ // / //
analyzed: kim tu tubhyam guṇaḥ hi asti dahane pavana īritaḥ
translated: But you have a quality in kindling the fire with wind.

original: na kāruṇyaṃ tvayā kiṃcid dākṣiṇyaṃ ca striyaṃ prati /
analyzed: na kāruṇyam tvayā kiṃcid dākṣiṇyam ca striyam prati
translated: You have no compassion or courtesy towards women at all.

original: dayāṃ mlecchā hi kurvanti vacanaṃ vīkṣya yoṣitām // / //
analyzed: dayām mlecchāḥ hi kurvanti vacanam vīkṣya yoṣitām
translated: Even the barbarians show mercy on hearing the words of women.

original: mlecchānām api ca mleccho durnivāryo hyacetanaḥ /🔽evaṃ vilapamānānāṃ strīṇāṃ tatraiva bhārata // / //
analyzed: mlecchānām api ca mlecchaḥ durnivāryaḥ hi acetanaḥ  evam vilapamānānām strīṇām tatra eva bhārata
translated: Even among barbarians, the barbarian is irrepressible and senseless.

analyzed: jvālā kalāpa bahulaḥ prajvalati eva pāvakaḥ
translated: O descendant of Bharata, the fire, full of clusters of flames, burns even there, where the women are lamenting like this.

original: evaṃ dṛṣṭvā tato bāṇo dahyamāna uvāca ha // / //
analyzed: evam dṛṣṭvā tatas bāṇaḥ dahyamānaḥ uvāca ha
translated: Having seen this, Bana then spoke, being burnt.

analyzed: avajñāya vinaṣṭaḥ ham pāpa ātmā haram añjasā
translated: I, the sinful one, have been destroyed by disrespecting Shiva quickly.

original: mayā pāpena mūrkheṇa ye lokā nāśitā dhruvam // / //
analyzed: mayā pāpena mūrkheṇa ye lokāḥ nāśitāḥ dhruvam
translated: By me, a sinful fool, the worlds are certainly destroyed.

original: gobrāhmaṇā hatā nityamiha loke paratra ca /
analyzed: go brāhmaṇāḥ hatāḥ nityam iha loke paratra ca
translated: Cows and Brahmins are always killed in this world and the next.

analyzed: nāśitāni anna pānāni maṭha ārāma āśramāḥ tathā
translated: Food, drink, monasteries, gardens, and hermitages are destroyed.

analyzed: ṛṣīṇām āśramāḥ ca eva deva ārāmāḥ gaṇa ālayāḥ
translated: The hermitages of the sages, the gardens of the gods, and the abodes of the Ganas,

original: tena pāpena me dhvaṃsastapasaśca balasya ca // / //
analyzed: tena pāpena me dhvaṃsaḥ tapasaḥ ca balasya ca
translated: By that sin, my destruction, austerity, and strength are lost.

analyzed: kim dhanena kariṣyāmi rājyeṇa antaḥpureṇa ca
translated: What will I do with wealth, kingdom, and harem?

original: varaṃ śaṅkarapādau ca śaraṇaṃ yāmi mūḍhadhīḥ /
analyzed: varam śaṅkara pādau ca śaraṇam yāmi mūḍha dhīḥ
translated: The deluded one seeks refuge at the feet of Shankara, the supreme.

original: na mātā na pitā caiva na bandhur nāparo janaḥ // / //
analyzed: na mātā na pitā ca eva na bandhuḥ na aparaḥ janaḥ
translated: There is no mother, no father, no relative, no other person,

analyzed: muktvā ca eva maheśānam parama ārti haram param
translated: Except for Mahesha, the supreme remover of great distress.

original: ātmanā ca kṛtaṃ pāpamātmanaiva tu bhujyate // / //
analyzed: ātmanā ca kṛtam pāpam ātmanā eva tu bhujyate
translated: The sin committed by oneself is indeed experienced by oneself alone.

original: ahaṃ punaḥ samastaiśca dahyāmi saha sādhubhiḥ /
analyzed: aham punar samastaiḥ ca dahyāmi saha sādhubhiḥ
translated: But I am again burned along with the virtuous ones.

original: evamuktvā śivaṃ liṅgaṃ kṛtvā tanmastakopari // / //🔽nirjagāma gṛhācchīghraṃ pāvakenāvaguṇṭhitaḥ /
analyzed: evam uktvā śivam liṅgam kṛtvā tad mastaka upari  nirjagāma gṛhāt śīghram pāvakena avaguṇṭhitaḥ
translated: Having said this, he placed the Shiva linga on his head,🔽And quickly left the house, enveloped in fire.

original: sa khinnaḥ svinnagātrastu praskhalaṃstu muhur muhuḥ // / //
analyzed: sa khinnaḥ svinna gātraḥ tu praskhalan tu muhur muhur
translated: He was exhausted, his body was sweaty, and he stumbled again and again.

original: haraṃ gadgadayā vācā stuvanvai śaraṇaṃ yayau /🔽tvatkopānalanirdagdho yadi vadhyo 'smi śaṅkara // / //
analyzed: haram gadgadayā vācā stuvan vai śaraṇam yayau  tvad kopa anala nirdagdhaḥ yadi vadhyaḥ smi śaṅkara
translated: Praising Hara with a stammering voice, he went for refuge.

original: tvatprasādānmahādeva mā me liṅgaṃ praṇaśyatu /🔽arcitaṃ me suraśreṣṭha dhyātaṃ bhaktyā mayā vibho // / //
analyzed: tvad prasādāt mahādeva mā me liṅgam praṇaśyatu  arcitam me suraśreṣṭha dhyātam bhaktyā mayā vibho
translated: If I am to be burned by the fire of your anger, O Śaṅkara, then may my penis not perish by your grace, O Mahādeva.

original: prāṇādiṣṭatamaṃ deva tasmād rakṣitum arhasi /🔽yadi te 'ham anugrāhyo vadhyo vā surasattama // / //
analyzed: prāṇa ādiṣṭatamam deva tasmāt rakṣitum arhasi  yadi te ham anugrāhyaḥ vadhyaḥ vā sura sattama
translated: O best of gods, worshipped by me, contemplated with devotion, O Lord, by me, O god, dearer to me than my life, therefore, it behoves you to protect it.

original: pratijanma mahādeva tvadbhaktiracalāstu me /🔽paśukīṭapataṅgeṣu tiryagyonigateṣu ca /
analyzed: pratijanma mahādeva tvad bhaktiḥ acalā astu me  paśu kīṭa pataṅgeṣu tiryagyoni gateṣu ca
translated: If I am to be favored by you, O best of gods, or if I am to be killed, then may my devotion to you be unshakable, O Mahādeva, in every birth.

analyzed: sva karmaṇā mahādeva tvad bhaktiḥ acalā astu me
translated: Even in animals, insects, and birds, in those born as lower animals, by my own karma, O Mahādeva, may my devotion to you be unshakable.

analyzed: evam uktvā mahābhāgaḥ bāṇaḥ bhaktimatām varaḥ
translated: Having said this, the illustrious Bāṇa, the best among the devotees,

analyzed: stotreṇa devadeveśam chandayāmāsa bhārata
translated: pleased the Lord of the Lord of gods with a hymn, O descendant of Bharata.

original: bāṇa uvāca /🔽śiva śaṅkara sarvaharāya namo bhavabhītabhayārtiharāya namaḥ /
analyzed: bāṇaḥ uvāca  śiva śaṅkara sarva harāya namaḥ bhava bhīta bhaya ārti harāya namaḥ
translated: Bāṇa said:🔽Salutations to Śiva, Śaṅkara, the destroyer of all, the remover of the fear and pain of those frightened of worldly existence.

analyzed: kusumāyudha deha vināśaṃkara pramadā priya kāmaka deva namaḥ
translated: O destroyer of the body of the flower-weaponed one, O god who delights in women and love, salutations to you.

analyzed: jaya pārvatīśa parama artha sāra jaya viracita bhīma bhujaṅga hāra
translated: Victory to the Lord of Parvati, the essence of the ultimate truth, victory to the one who has fashioned a garland of terrible serpents,

analyzed: jaya nirmala bhasma vilipta gātra jaya mantra mūla jagat eka pātra
translated: Victory to the one whose body is smeared with pure ash, victory to the one who is the root of mantras, the sole vessel of the world.

original: jaya viṣadharakapilajaṭākalāpa jaya bhairavavighṛtapinākacāpa /🔽jaya viṣamanayanaparimuktasaṅga jaya śaṅkara dhṛtagāṅgataraṅga // / //🔽jaya bhīmarūpa khaṭvāṅgahasta śaśiśekhara jaya jagatāṃ praśasta /
analyzed: jaya viṣadhara kapila jaṭā kalāpa jaya bhairava vighṛta pināka cāpa  jaya viṣama nayana parimukta saṅga jaya śaṅkara dhṛta gāṅga taraṅga  jaya bhīma rūpa khaṭvāṅga hasta śaśiśekhara jaya jagatām praśasta
translated: Victory to the one whose matted hair is tawny like a cobra, victory to the one who has shattered the Pinaka bow of Bhairava,🔽Victory to the one who is free from attachment to the angry eyes, victory to Shankara who holds the waves of the Ganges.🔽Victory to the one with a terrible form, holding a skull-topped staff, and a moon crest, victory to the one praised by the worlds.

analyzed: jaya sukhara īśa sura loka sāra jaya sarva sakala nirdagdha sāra
translated: Victory to the one who is the essence of the world of gods, victory to the one who has burnt away all that is impure.

original: jaya kīrtanīya jagatāṃ pavitra jaya vṛṣāṅka bahuvidhacaritra /🔽jaya viracitanarakaṅkālamāla aghāsuradehakaṅkālakāla // / //
analyzed: jaya kīrtanīya jagatām pavitra jaya vṛṣāṅka bahuvidha caritra  jaya viracita nara kaṅkāla māla agha asura deha kaṅkāla kāla
translated: Victory to the one who is to be praised by the worlds, the purifier, victory to the one with the mark of a bull, with many kinds of deeds.🔽Victory to the one who has fashioned a garland of the bones of Naraka, the dark one, the skeleton of the body of the demon Aghasura.

analyzed: jaya nīlakaṃṭha vara vṛṣabha gamana jaya sakala loka durita anuśamana
translated: Victory to the blue-throated one, who moves on an excellent bull, victory to the one who pacifies the miseries of all the worlds.

analyzed: jaya siddha sura asura vinata caraṇa jaya rudra raudra bhava jaladhi taraṇa
translated: Victory to the one whose feet are bowed to by accomplished gods and demons, victory to Rudra who crosses the ocean of terrible worldly existence.

original: jaya giriśa sureśvaramānanīya jaya sūkṣmarūpa saṃcitanīya /
analyzed: jaya giriśa sureśvara mānanīya jaya sūkṣma rūpa saṃcitanīya
translated: Victory to Girisha, the one to be worshipped by the Lord of gods, victory to the one of subtle form, to be contemplated upon.

analyzed: jaya dagdha tripura viśva sattva jaya sakala śāstra parama artha tattva
translated: Victory to the one who burnt Tripura, the essence of the universe, victory to the one who is the truth of the ultimate reality of all scriptures.

analyzed: jaya duravabodha saṃsāra tāra kali kaluṣa mahā arṇava ghora tāra
translated: Victory to the one who is difficult to understand, the savior from worldly existence, the terrible savior from the great ocean of the Kali age's impurities.

analyzed: jaya sura asura deva gaṇeśa namaḥ haya vānara siṃha gaja indra mukha
translated: Victory to the one who is the chief of the hosts of gods, demons, and celestial beings, salutations to the one with the faces of a horse, monkey, lion, and the chief of elephants.

original: atihrasvasthūlasudīrghatama upalabdhir na śakyate te hyamaraiḥ /
analyzed: ati hrasva sthūla su dīrgha tamaḥ upalabdhiḥ na śakyate te hi amaraiḥ
translated: Your size is extremely small, thick, and very long, it cannot be comprehended by the immortals.

original: praṇato 'smi nirañjana te caraṇau jaya sāmba sulocanakāntihara // / //
analyzed: praṇataḥ smi nirañjana te caraṇau jaya sāmba su locana kānti hara
translated: I bow to your feet, O Nirjanta, victory to you, O Sambhu, O remover of the beauty of the eyes of the beautiful-eyed one.

original: aprāpya tvāṃ kim atyantam ucchrayī na vināśayet /
analyzed: a prāpya tvām kim atyantam ucchrayī na vināśayet
translated: Without attaining you, how can one who is extremely tall be destroyed?

analyzed: atipramāthi ca tadā tapaḥ mahat su dāruṇam
translated: And then, the great and extremely terrible austerity becomes very destructive.

original: na putrabāndhavā dārā na samastaḥ suhṛjjanaḥ /
analyzed: na putra bāndhavāḥ dārāḥ na samastaḥ suhṛd janaḥ
translated: Neither sons nor relatives, neither wives nor all the well-wishers,

analyzed: saṅkaṭe bhyupagacchanti vrajantam eka gāminam
translated: accompany one who is going alone in a difficult situation.

original: yadeva karma kaivalyaṃ kṛtaṃ tena śubhāśubham /
analyzed: yat eva karma kaivalyam kṛtam tena śubha aśubham
translated: Whatever karma, good or bad, has been done by him,

original: tadeva sārthavat tasya bhavatyagre tu gacchataḥ // / //
analyzed: tat eva sārthavat tasya bhavati agre tu gacchataḥ
translated: that alone becomes meaningful for him as he goes ahead.

original: nirdhanasyaiva carato na bhayaṃ vidyate kvacit /
analyzed: nirdhanasya eva carataḥ na bhayam vidyate kvacid
translated: One who moves about without wealth has no fear from anywhere.

analyzed: dhanī bhayaiḥ na mucyeta dhanam tasmāt tyajāmi aham
translated: One who is wealthy is not free from the fear of wealth. Therefore, I abandon wealth.

original: lubdhāḥ pāpāni kurvanti śuddhāṃśā naiva mānavāḥ /
analyzed: lubdhāḥ pāpāni kurvanti śuddha aṃśāḥ na eva mānavāḥ
translated: The greedy commit sins, not pure-hearted men.

original: śrutvā dharmasya sarvasvaṃ śrutvā caivāvadhārya tat // / //
analyzed: śrutvā dharmasya sarvasvam śrutvā ca eva avadhārya tat
translated: Having heard the essence of Dharma and having understood it,

analyzed: tvam viṣṇuḥ tvam jagannāthaḥ brahma rūpaḥ sanātanaḥ
translated: You are Vishnu, you are the lord of the world, you are the eternal form of Brahma.

analyzed: indraḥ tvam devadeveśa sura nātha namaḥ stu te
translated: You are Indra, the lord of the gods, the lord of the celestials, salutations to you.

analyzed: tvam kṣitiḥ varuṇaḥ ca eva pavanaḥ tvam hutāśanaḥ
translated: You are the earth, you are Varuna, you are the wind, you are the fire.

original: tvaṃ dīkṣā yajamānaśca ākāśaṃ soma eva ca // / //
analyzed: tvam dīkṣā yajamānaḥ ca ākāśam somaḥ eva ca
translated: You are the initiation, you are the sacrificer, you are the sky, you are the moon.

original: tvaṃ sūryastvaṃ tu vitteśo yamastvaṃ gurureva ca /
analyzed: tvam sūryaḥ tvam tu vitteśaḥ yamaḥ tvam guruḥ eva ca
translated: You are the sun, you are Kubera, you are Yama, you are the preceptor.

original: tvayā vyāptaṃ jagatsarvaṃ trailokyaṃ bhāsvatā yathā // / //
analyzed: tvayā vyāptam jagat sarvam trailokyam bhāsvatā yathā
translated: The entire universe is pervaded by you, as the three worlds are illuminated by the shining one.

analyzed: etat bāṇa kṛtam stotram śrutvā devaḥ maheśvaraḥ
translated: Having heard this hymn composed by Bana, Lord Mahesvara

original: krodhaṃ muktvā prasannātmā tadā vacanam abravīt // / //
analyzed: krodham muktvā prasanna ātmā tadā vacanam abravīt
translated: released his anger and with a delighted mind, spoke these words.

analyzed: īśvaraḥ uvāca
translated: Ishvara said:

analyzed: na bhetavyam na bhetavyam adya prabhṛti dānava
translated: From now on, O Danava, you need not fear.

original: sauvarṇe bhavane tiṣṭha mama pārśve 'thavā punaḥ // / //
analyzed: sauvarṇe bhavane tiṣṭha mama pārśve punar
translated: Or stay by my side in a golden palace.

analyzed: putra pautra prapautraiḥ ca bāndhavaiḥ saha bhāryayā
translated: With sons, grandsons, great-grandsons, relatives and wife,

analyzed: adya prabhṛti vatsa tvam avadhyaḥ sarva śatruṣu
translated: From today onwards, O child, you are invincible to all enemies.

original: mārkaṇḍeya uvāca /🔽bhūyastasya varo datto devadevena bhārata /
analyzed: mārkaṇḍeyaḥ uvāca  bhūyas tasya varaḥ dattaḥ devadevena bhārata

analyzed: uttamam paramam puṇyam kuṇḍaleśvara nāmataḥ

analyzed: tāpasī tasya bhaginī yājñavalkyasya dhīmataḥ

analyzed: cacāra sā api tatrasthā śuśrūṣantī mahat tapaḥ

analyzed: kasmiṃścid samaye sā atha snātā ahani rajasvalā

analyzed: antarvāsaḥ dhṛtavatī dṛṣṭvā karpaṭakam rahaḥ

analyzed: yājñavalkyaḥ pi tad rātrau suptaḥ yatra su saṃvṛtaḥ
translated: Yajnavalkya too, having slept that night well covered,

analyzed: virājitena tapasā siddham tat anala prabham
translated: That semen, radiant with penance, accomplished, having the luster of fire,

analyzed: yāvat prabuddhaḥ vīkṣya ucchiṣṭam tat aṃśukam
translated: When the brahmin woke up and saw that garment soiled,

analyzed: niśīthe sā api tat vastram bhagasya āvaraṇam vyadhāt

analyzed: prātar anveṣayāmāsa muniḥ vastram itas tatas

analyzed: tatas sā brāhmaṇī prāha kim anveṣayase prabho

analyzed: kena kāryam tava tathā vadasva mama tattvataḥ
translated: What is your purpose? Tell me the truth.

analyzed: yājñavalkyaḥ uvāca
translated: Yajnavalkya said:

analyzed: sa kledam tatra me vastram nikṣiptam tat na dṛśyate

analyzed: tat śrutvā brāhmaṇī vākyam bhīta bhītā avadat nṛpa
translated: Hearing those words, the brahmani spoke fearfully, O king:

analyzed: tasyāḥ tat vacanam śrutvā hāhā iti uktvā mahā muniḥ
