original: iti śrīskānde mahāpurāṇa ekāśītisāhasryāṃ saṃhitāyāṃ pañcama āvantyakhaṇḍe revākhaṇḍe loṭaṇeśvaratīrthamāhātmyavarṇanaṃ nāma viṃśatyuttaradviśatatamo 🔽'dhyāyaḥ //🔽RKV adhyāya🔽śrīmārkaṇḍeya uvāca /🔽tato gacchettu rājendra revāyā dakṣiṇe taṭe /
analyzed: iti śrī skānde mahāpurāṇe ekāśīti sāhasryām saṃhitāyām pañcame āvantya khaṇḍe revākhaṇḍe loṭaṇeśvaratīrthamāhātmyavarṇanam nāma viṃśati uttara dviśatatamaḥ 🔽dhyāyaḥ 🔽rku adhyāya 🔽śrī mārkaṇḍeyaḥ uvāca 🔽tatas gacchet tu rāja indra revāyāḥ dakṣiṇe taṭe
translated: Thus ends the two hundred twentieth chapter in the Vamana Purana, describing the greatness of Lotaneshvara TIrtha in the fifth Avanti Khanda.

analyzed: krośa dvaya antare tīrtham matṛtīrthāt anuttamam
translated: At a distance of two kroshas from Matritīrtha, there is an excellent holy place,

analyzed: nāmnā haṃseśvaram puṇyam vaimanasya vināśanam
translated: known as Hamsīśvara, meritorious and destructive of dejection.

analyzed: kaśyapasya kule jātaḥ haṃsaḥ dākṣāyaṇī sutaḥ
translated: Born in the family of Kaśyapa, the swan was the son of Dākṣāyaṇī.

original: brahmaṇo vāhanaṃ jātaḥ purā taptvā tapo mahat /
analyzed: brahmaṇaḥ vāhanam jātaḥ purā taptvā tapaḥ mahat
translated: In ancient times, after performing great austerities, he became the vehicle of Brahmā.

analyzed: sā ekadā vidhi nirdeśam vinā vaiyagryam āsthitaḥ
translated: Once, without the instruction of Brahmā, he became engaged in his own activities.

analyzed: abhibhūtaḥ śiva gaṇaiḥ praṇanāśa yudhiṣṭhira
translated: He was overpowered by Śiva's attendants and was cursed, O Yudhiṣṭhira.

analyzed: dakṣa yajña pramathane kāṃdiśīkaḥ vidhim vinā
translated: When he was crushed in Dakṣa's sacrifice, he was confused without Brahmā.

original: brahmaṇā saṃsṛto 'pyāśu nāyāti sa yadā khagaḥ /
analyzed: brahmaṇā saṃsṛtaḥ u pi āśu na āyāti sa yadā khagaḥ
translated: Even when reminded by Brahmā, the bird did not come quickly.

original: tadā taṃ śaptavānbrahmā pātayāmāsa vai padāt // / //🔽tataḥ sa śaptamātmānaṃ matvā haṃsastvarānvitaḥ /
analyzed: tadā tam śaptavān brahmā pātayāmāsa vai padāt  tatas sa śaptam ātmānam matvā haṃsaḥ tvarā anvitaḥ
translated: Then Brahmā cursed him and made him fall from his position.

analyzed: pitāmaham upāgamya praṇipatya idam abravīt
translated: Then the swan, considering himself cursed, quickly approached the grandfather and, bowing down, said this:

analyzed: haṃsaḥ uvāca
translated: The swan said:

analyzed: tiryagyoni samutpannam bhavān śaptum na ca arhati
translated: You should not curse me, born in the animal realm.

analyzed: svabhāvaḥ eva tiryakṣu viveka vikalam manaḥ
translated: The mind of animals is naturally devoid of discrimination.

original: tathāpi deva pāpo 'smi yadahaṃ svāminaṃ tyaje /
analyzed: tathā api deva pāpaḥ smi yat aham svāminam tyaje
translated: Nevertheless, O Lord, I am sinful in that I abandon my master.

original: kiṃ tu dhāvadbhir atyugrairgaṇaiḥ śārvaiḥ pitāmaha /
analyzed: kim tu dhāvadbhiḥ ati ugraiḥ gaṇaiḥ śārvaiḥ pitāmaha
translated: But, O Grandfather, I was terrified and fled in fear, leaving everything behind,

analyzed: sahasā aham bhaya ākrāntaḥ trastaḥ tyaktvā palāyitaḥ
translated: when I saw the fierce and terrible hordes of Shiva's followers running after me.

analyzed: adyā api bhayam eva aham paśyan asmi vibho puras
translated: Even now, O Lord, I see fear before me.

analyzed: tena smṛtaḥ u pi bhavatā na avrajam bhavat antike
translated: Therefore, though remembered by you, I did not come into your presence.

analyzed: śrī mārkaṇḍeyaḥ uvāca
translated: The illustrious Markandeya said:

original: iti bruvanneva hi dhāturagre haṃsaḥ śvasatyakṣipūjyaḥ sudīnaḥ /
analyzed: iti bruvan eva hi dhātuḥ agre haṃsaḥ śvasati akṣi pūjyaḥ su dīnaḥ
translated: Thus speaking, the swan, the self-luminous one, the most venerable among the gods, was sighing deeply and was extremely distressed.

original: tiryañcaṃ māṃ pāpinaṃ mūḍhabuddhiṃ prabho puraḥ patitaṃ pāhi pāhi // / //
analyzed: tiryañcam mām pāpinam mūḍha buddhim prabho puras patitam pāhi pāhi
translated: O Lord, save me, save me, a sinner, a beast, of deluded mind, who has fallen before you.

original: eko devastvaṃ hi sargasya kartā nānāvidhaṃ sṛṣṭametattvayaiva /
analyzed: ekaḥ devaḥ tvam hi sargasya kartā nānāvidham sṛṣṭam etat tvayā eva
translated: You alone are the one God, the creator of this creation. This diverse creation has been created by you alone.

original: ahaṃ sṛṣṭastvīdṛśo yattvayā vai so 'yaṃ doṣo dhātar addhā tavaiva // / //
analyzed: aham sṛṣṭaḥ tu īdṛśaḥ yat tvayā vai saḥ yam doṣaḥ dhātar addhā tava eva
translated: I have been created by you in this way. This fault, O Creator, is indeed yours alone.

original: śāpasya vānugrahasyāpi śaktastvatto nānyaḥ śaraṇaṃ kaṃ vrajāmi /
analyzed: śāpasya vā anugrahasya api śaktaḥ tvattaḥ nā anyaḥ śaraṇam kam vrajāmi
translated: You alone are capable of cursing or blessing. I have no other refuge than you. Where shall I go?

original: sevādharmādvicyutaṃ dāsabhūtaṃ capeṭairhantavyaṃ vai tāta māṃ trāhi bhaktam // / //
analyzed: sevā dharmāt vicyutam dāsa bhūtam capeṭaiḥ hantavyam vai tāta mām trāhi bhaktam
translated: Save me, O father, your devoted servant who has fallen from the duty of service and has become a slave, who is to be beaten with slaps.

original: vidyāvidye tvatta evāvirāstāṃ dharmādharmau sadasad dyurniśe ca /
analyzed: vidyā avidye tvattaḥ eva āvirāstām dharma adharmau sat asat ca
translated: Knowledge and ignorance have manifested from you alone, as have virtue and vice, existence and non-existence, and day and night.

original: nānābhāvāñjagatastvaṃ vidhatses taṃ tvāmekaṃ śaraṇaṃ vai prapadye // / //
analyzed: nānābhāvān jagataḥ tvam vidhatseḥ tam tvām ekam śaraṇam vai prapadye
translated: You create the various states of the world. I take refuge in you alone.

analyzed: ekaḥ si bahu rūpaḥ si nānā citra eka karmataḥ
translated: You are one, you have many forms, due to your various wonderful actions.

original: niṣkarmākhilakarmāsi tvāmataḥ śaraṇaṃ vraje // / //🔽namonamo vareṇyāya varadāya namonamaḥ /
analyzed: niṣkarmā akhila karmā asi tvām atas śaraṇam vraje  namaḥ namaḥ vareṇyāya vara dāya namaḥ namaḥ
translated: You are beyond action, yet you perform all actions. Therefore, I take refuge in you.🔽Salutations, salutations to the most excellent one, to the giver of boons, salutations again and again.

original: namo dhātre vidhātre ca śaraṇyāya namonamaḥ // / //🔽śikṣākṣaraviyukteyaṃ vāṇī me stauti kiṃ vibho /
analyzed: namaḥ dhātre vidhātre ca śaraṇyāya namaḥ namaḥ  śikṣā akṣara viyuktā iyam vāṇī me stauti kim vibho
translated: Salutations to the creator, to the ordainer, to the one who is to be sought refuge in, salutations again and again.🔽O Lord, this speech of mine, devoid of the letters of instruction, is praising you. What can it do?

original: kā śaktiḥ kiṃ parijñānamidamuktaṃ kṣamasva me // / //
analyzed: kā śaktiḥ kim parijñānam idam uktam kṣamasva me
translated: What is the power? What is the knowledge? This is what is said. Forgive me.

analyzed: śrī mārkaṇḍeyaḥ uvāca
translated: The glorious Markandeya said:

original: evaṃ vadati haṃse vai brahmā prāha prasannadhīḥ /
analyzed: evam vadati haṃse vai brahmā prāha prasanna dhīḥ
translated: When the swan was speaking thus, Brahma, with a pleased mind, said:

original: śikṣā dattā tavaiveyaṃ mā viṣādaṃ kṛthāḥ khaga // / //
analyzed: śikṣā dattā tava evā iyam mā viṣādam kṛthāḥ khaga
translated: This instruction has been given to you alone. Do not be sad, O bird.

analyzed: tapasā śodhaya ātmānam yathā śāpa antam āpnuyāḥ
translated: Purify yourself through austerities so that you may attain the end of the curse.

analyzed: revā sevām kuru snātvā sthāpayitvā maheśvaram
translated: Serve the Revā river, bathe in it, and install Maheśvara.

analyzed: acireṇa eva kālena tatas saṃsthānam āpsyasi
translated: Then, in a short time, you will attain your original form.

analyzed: yat ca iṣṭvā bahubhiḥ yajñaiḥ samāpta vara dakṣiṇaiḥ
translated: Even if one performs many sacrifices with excellent gifts given at the end,

analyzed: go svarṇa koṭi dānaiḥ ca tat phalam sthāpite śive
translated: By installing Shiva, one attains the same fruit as by giving away crores of cows and gold.

original: brahmaghno vā surāpo vā svarṇahṛd gurutalpagaḥ /
analyzed: brahma ghnaḥ vā surā paḥ vā svarṇa hṛt gurutalpa gaḥ
translated: Even if one has killed a Brahmin, drunk liquor, stolen gold, or violated one's guru's bed,

analyzed: revā tīre śivam sthāpya mucyate sarva pātakaiḥ
translated: by installing Shiva on the banks of the Revā, one is freed from all sins.

analyzed: tasmāt bhargasarit tīre sthāpayitvā triyambakam
translated: Therefore, by installing Tryambaka on the banks of the Bhargā river,

original: viyuktaḥ sarvadoṣaistvaṃ yāsyase padamuttamam // / //🔽evamuktaḥ sa vidhinā hṛṣṭatuṣṭaḥ khagottamaḥ /
analyzed: viyuktaḥ sarva doṣaiḥ tvam yāsyase padam uttamam  evam uktaḥ sa vidhinā hṛṣṭa tuṣṭaḥ khaga uttamaḥ
translated: you will be free from all faults and go to the highest state.🔽Thus addressed by Brahmā, the best of birds, delighted and satisfied,

analyzed: tathā iti uktvā jagāma āśu narmadā tīram uttamam
translated: said So be it and quickly went to the excellent banks of the Narmadā.

analyzed: tapaḥ taptvā kiyatkālam sthāpayāmāsa śaṅkaram
translated: Having performed austerities for some time, he installed Śaṅkara.

analyzed: sva nāmnā bharata śreṣṭha haṃseśvaram anuttamam
translated: O best of the Bharatas, by his own name, the excellent Hāṃseśvara.

analyzed: pūjayitvā param sthānam prāptavān khaga sattamaḥ
translated: Having worshipped, the best of birds attained the highest state.

original: tatra haṃseśvare tīrthe gatvā snātvā yudhiṣṭhira /
analyzed: tatra haṃseśvare tīrthe gatvā snātvā yudhiṣṭhira
translated: O Yudhiṣṭhira, having gone to the Hāṃseśvara Tīrtha there and bathed,

analyzed: pūjayet parameśānam sa pāpaiḥ parimucyate
translated: one should worship the Supreme Lord and is freed from all sins.

original: stuvannekamanā devaṃ na dainyaṃ prāpnuyāt kvacit /
analyzed: stuvan ekamanāḥ devam na dainyam prāpnuyāt kvacid
translated: Praising the Lord with a focused mind, one will never experience misery anywhere.

original: śrāddhaṃ dīpapradānaṃ ca brāhmaṇānāṃ ca bhojanam /
analyzed: śrāddham dīpa pradānam ca brāhmaṇānām ca bhojanam
translated: Śrāddha, offering of lamps, and feeding of Brāhmaṇas,

analyzed: dattvā śaktyā nṛpa śreṣṭha svarga loke mahīyate
translated: O best of kings, by giving according to one's ability, one is honored in the heavenly world.

original: trikālam ekakālaṃ vā yo bhaktyā pūjayecchivam /
analyzed: tri kālam eka kālam vā yaḥ bhaktyā pūjayet śivam
translated: One who devoutly worships Shiva three times or once a day,

original: navaprasūtāṃ dhenuṃ ca dattvā pārtha dvijottame /
analyzed: nava prasūtām dhenum ca dattvā pārtha dvijottame
translated: and gives a newly delivered cow to an excellent Brahmin, O Partha,

analyzed: ṣaṣṭi varṣa sahasrāṇi śiva loke mahīyate
translated: is honored in Shiva's world for sixty thousand years.

original: iti śrīskānde mahāpurāṇa ekāśītisāhasryāṃ saṃhitāyāṃ pañcama āvantyakhaṇḍe revākhaṇḍe haṃseśvaratīrthamāhātmyavarṇanaṃ nāmaikaviṃśadadhikadviśatatamo 🔽'dhyāyaḥ //
analyzed: iti śrī skānde mahāpurāṇe ekāśīti sāhasryām saṃhitāyām pañcame āvantya khaṇḍe revākhaṇḍe haṃseśvaratīrthamāhātmyavarṇanam nāma ekaviṃśat adhika dviśatatamaḥ  dhyāyaḥ
translated: Thus ends the twenty-first chapter in the Skanda Purana, in the fifth Avantaka Khaṇḍa, in the Reva Khaṇḍa, describing the greatness of Hamsesvara Tīrtha.

analyzed: rku adhyāya
translated: Chapter 22

analyzed: śrī mārkaṇḍeyaḥ uvāca
translated: Śrī Mārkaṇḍeya said:

translated: Then one should go to the excellent Tīlāḍa Tīrtha, two miles away,

translated: No one associates with him even in assemblies.🔽Thus, O king, the brahmin, full of shame, after a long time,

analyzed: cakāra sarva tīrthāni revām ca api avagāhayat

analyzed: tasthau yatra vratī pārtha jābāliḥ prāśayan tilān
translated: where the vow-observing Pārtha Jābāli lived, eating sesame seeds.

analyzed: tilaiḥ eka aśanam kurvan tathā eva ekāntara aśanam
translated: Eating sesame seeds at one time, and likewise at every second time,

analyzed: tri aha ṣaṣ dvādaśa aha āśī pakṣa māsa aśanaḥ tathā
translated: eating every third, sixth, or twelfth day, and likewise every fortnight or month,

analyzed: kṛcchra cāndrāyaṇa ādīni vratāni ca tilaiḥ api
translated: even the austerities like Kṛcchra, Cāndrāyaṇa, and other vows are performed with sesame seeds.

analyzed: tila āda tvam anuprāptaḥ hi abda dvāsaptatim kramāt
translated: Having attained the state of being a sesame seed eater, he gradually attained the state of being a sesame seed eater for seventy-two years.

analyzed: kālena gacchatā tasya prasannaḥ bhavat īśvaraḥ
translated: As time passed, the Lord became pleased with him.

analyzed: prādāt iha āmutrikīm tu śuddhim sālokyam ātmakam
translated: He granted him purification in this world and the next, and the state of dwelling in the same world as the Lord.

analyzed: tena sa sthāpitaḥ devaḥ sva nāmnā bharata ṛṣabha
translated: O best of the Bharata lineage, the Lord was installed by him with his own name.

analyzed: tilāda īśvara saṃjñām ca prāpa lokāt api prabhuḥ
translated: And the Lord attained the name Tilādeśvara even in the world.

analyzed: tadā prabhṛti vikhyātam tīrtham pāpa praṇāśanam
translated: Since then, that tirtha became famous as the destroyer of sins.

analyzed: tatra tīrthe naraḥ snātvā caturdaśī aṣṭamīṣu ca
translated: A man who bathes in that tirtha on the eighth and fourteenth days,

analyzed: upavāsa paraḥ pārtha tathā eva harivāsare
translated: devoted to fasting, O Partha, and on the day of Hari (i.e. eleventh day),

analyzed: tila homī tila udvartī tila snāyī tila udakī
translated: who offers sesame seeds, applies sesame oil, bathes with sesame oil, drinks sesame water,

analyzed: tila dātā ca bhoktā ca nānā pāpaiḥ pramucyate

analyzed: tilaiḥ āpūrayet liṅgam tila tailena dīpa daḥ
translated: One who fills a linga with sesame seeds, offers a lamp with sesame oil,

analyzed: rudra lokam avāpnoti punāti ā saptamam kulam
translated: attains Rudra's world and purifies his family up to the seventh generation.

analyzed: tila piṇḍa pradānena śrāddhe nṛpati sattama
translated: By offering sesame seed balls in the ancestral offering ceremony, O best of kings,

analyzed: vikarma sthāḥ ca gacchanti gatim iṣṭām hi pūrvajāḥ
translated: even those engaged in wrong actions go to the desired destination, the ancestors.

analyzed: svarga loka sthitāḥ śrāddhaiḥ brāhmaṇānām ca bhojanaiḥ
translated: Those who are in heaven, by ancestral offerings and feeding Brahmins,

analyzed: akṣayām tṛptim āsādya modante śāśvatīḥ samāḥ
translated: attain eternal satisfaction and rejoice for eternal years.

original: pituḥ kulaṃ mātṛkulaṃ tathā bhāryākulaṃ nṛpa /
analyzed: pituḥ kulam mātṛ kulam tathā bhāryā kulam nṛpa
translated: The father's family, the mother's family, and the wife's family, O king,

analyzed: kula trayam samuddhṛtya svargam nayati vai naraḥ
translated: a man rescues these three families and leads them to heaven.
